Jack S. Amos
SOURCE: Daily Jeffersonian . . Cambridge, OH . . Jan 2002 . . COURTESY POST ONLY
WOODSFIELD Jack S. Amos, 73, of New Matamoras R.D. 1, died Wednesday (Jan. 9, 2002) at his home.
He was born April 8, 1928, in New Matamoras, son of the late Arch and Irene Cochran Amos.
 
He was a retired iron worker and a Protestant by faith.
 
He was preceded in death by his wife, Janena Beaver Amos, in 1999, and a brother, Robert Amos.
He leaves two sons, Dennis Amos of Tuscaloosa, Ala., and Tom Amos of Sardis; a daughter, Jane Kinsey of New Matamoras; a brother, Don Amos of New Matamoras; two sisters, Helen Amos of Summerfield and Ruth Ann Heiney of New Matamoras; nine grandchildren.
 
Graveside services will be 11 a.m. Saturday at New Matamoras Cemetery with the Rev. Frank Conley officiating.
Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, Woodsfield, is handling the arrangements.
 
2002
DAILY JEFF - JAN 11, 2002XXXXx
Lotetta Betts
QUAKER CITY Services will be 11 a.m. Saturday at Thorn-Black Funeral Home, Quaker City, for Loretta Betts, 76, of Quaker City, who died Thursday (Jan. 10, 2002) at Southeastern Med, Cambridge.
The Rev. Raymond Ake will officiate.
Burial will be in Friends Cemetery.
Friends may call from 7 to 9 p.m. today at the funeral home.
She was born Oct. 2, 1925, in Quaker City, daughter of the late Clyde and Ada (Linton) Hall Hannahs.
She graduated in 1943 from Quaker City High School.
She retired in 1991 after 30 years with the former Quaker City National Bank. Mrs. Betts attended the Quaker City United Methodist Church, where she belonged to its United Methodist Women organization. She was a former member of the Quaker City Eastern Star, and a member of Leatherwood Senior Citizens.
Mrs. Betts, along with her husband Paul, raised quarter horses.
She leaves Paul, whom she married Aug. 2, 1947; two daughters, Paula (J. Dean) Winland and Shelley (Dennis Doc ) Eddy, all of Barnesville; two brothers, Clyde J. (Mona) Hall of Nashport and Joseph A. (Adrienne) Hall of Brewster; a sister, Mary Pauline (Carl) Starr of Massillon; six grandchildren, Jason Winland of Beallsville, Jill Detling, Justin Winland, Ryon Eddy and Brandon Eddy, all of Barnesville, and Heather Roe of Salesville; eight great-grandchildren.
Memorial contributions may be made to Quaker City United Methodist Church or the Leatherwood Senior Citizens.
2002
Jan 12, Bellefontaine Examiner,
Maude Clarinda Lewis Evans Scheiderer
Maude Clarinda Lewis Evans Scheiderer, 94, a longtime Marysville resident, passed away Saturday, Jan. 12, 2002, at Heartland of Marysville.
 
She was born in Shawnee on June 5, 1907, a daughter of the late David and Sarah Anderson Lewis.
 
She was preceded in death by her first husband, Ralph Everett Evans, and second husband, Julius George Scheiderer. An infant son, Ralph E. Evans; one daughter, Eloise M. Carlson; a stepson, Carlton Scheiderer; a son-in-law, Thomas Davie; and one brother and four sisters also preceded her in death.
 
A retired school teacher, she taught at the Broadway, Unionville Center and Milford Center schools, much loved by her students. She was a graduate of the College of Normal School Education, now known as Ohio University. She later received a bachelor's degree in education from Ohio Northern University.
 
She was a member of the Springdale Baptist Church of Marysville and was a former member of the West Mansfield Baptist Church and the Memorial Baptist Church of Columbus. She enjoyed singing with the Windsor Manor Singers and performing at numerous functions.
 
She is survived by four daughters, Maude Evelyn (Ervin) Coffman of Columbus, Geraldine Ann (Charlie) Miller of Jerome, Ruth Elaine (Gary) Lentz of Berry Creek, Calif., and Betty June Davie of West Mansfield; a stepson, Clifton (Joy) Scheiderer of New California; a sister, Della Mae Christman of Somerset; a brother, the Rev. David (Evelyn) Lewis of Danville, Ill.; son-in-law, Charles Carlson of Palisade, Minn.; 17 grandchildren; 26 great-grandchildren; three great-great-grandchildren; nine stepgrandchildren; 13 great-stepgrandchildren; six great-great-stepgrandchildren; and many nieces and nephews. She will be sadly missed by her family and many friends.
 
 
Daily Jeff , Jan 16, 2002
Harry V. Pete Zonker
WOODSFIELD Harry V. Pete Zonker, 94, of Woodsfield, died Monday (Jan. 14, 2002) at the Monroe County Care Center, Woodsfield.
He was born June 7, 1907, in Bellaire, son of the late Homer and Mary Elizabeth (Harper) Zonker.
Mr. Zonker was a retired welder, having served as owner and operator of the former Pete s Welding in Woodsfield for 40 years.
He was a member of Woodsfield United Methodist Church, where he served as an usher for several years.
He was a member of Stafford Lodge 300 F&AM, the Ancient Accepted Scottish Rite, Valley of Cambridge, and Huffman Grange.
He was preceded in death by his wife, Fannie L. (Dickson) Zonker, on July 31, 2001; two sisters, Gladys Motter and Lillian Fox; five brothers, Robert, Ray, Darrel, Roy and John Zonker.
He leaves two brothers, George Zonker of Woodsfield, and Kenneth Zonker of Houston, Texas; and several nieces and nephews.
Friends may call from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Thursday at Watters Funeral Home, Woodsfield, where services will be 1 p.m. Friday with Pastor Travis Christman and the Rev. Dwaine Denis officiating. Masonic services will be conducted by Stafford Lodge 300 F&AM Thursday at 7:30 p.m. at the funeral home.
Burial will be in Friendship Cemetery, Lewisville.
Memorial contributions may be made to Woodsfield United Methodist Church, c/o Organ Fund, 136 N. Main St., Woodsfield, OH 43793.
 
Daily Jeff Jan 17, 2002
Jean Sutton
WOODSFIELD Jean Sutton, 74, of Woodsfield, died Tuesday (Jan. 15, 2002) in Sunbury.
She was born Dec. 23, 1927, in Wheeling, W.Va., daughter of the late Robert and Elizabeth (Quinn) Darnley.
Mrs. Sutton was a former employee of Kut and Kurl Beauty Shop of Woodsfield.
She was preceded in death by her husband, Charles Sutton, on June 18, 1979.
She leaves two sons, Charles Sutton Jr. of Las Vegas, Nev., and Howard Sutton of Columbus; three daughters, Coquette Sutton of Cameron, Linda Showalter of Ellicott City, Md., and Sherry Straub of Sunbury; a brother, George Darnley of Wheeling, W.Va.; 11 grandchildren and two great-grandchildren.
Friends may call from 3 to 5 p.m. Friday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, Woodsfield, where a memorial service will follow at 5 p.m. with Minister Sam Bartrug officiating.

Workman, Homer Elroy
SOURCE: Marietta Times . . . Marietta, OH . . Jan 2002
Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
. . WOODSFIELD - Homer Elroy Workman, 67, of Flauhaus Ridge Road died Sunday (Jan. 20, 2002) at the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center.
He was born in Monroe County to Homer M. and Eunice Henderlong Workman. He was a U.S. Air Force veteran and was retired from Conalco Corp. at Hannibal. He was a member of Laings Presbyterian Church, Center Grange, American Legion Post 0760 at Hannibal, Senior Citizens Group at Clarington, and Christian Singles & Doubles at New Martinsville, W.Va.
He is survived by his wife, Caroline Lively Workman; two sons, Trent Workman and Keith Workman; one daughter, Lesia Stone; his mother of Laings; one sister, Darlene Quails of Woodsfield; seven stepchildren; two grandchildren; 14 stepgrandchildren; and four stepgreat-grandchildren.
He was preceded in death by his father.
Services are at 11 a.m. Wednesday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, with Pastor Michael Anderson officiating. Burial is in Oaklawn Cemetery at Woodsfield with military graveside services. Friends will be received from 2 to 9 p.m. today at the funeral home. Center Grange services are at 6 p.m. today at the funeral home
 
Daily Jeff, January 21, 2002X
Kenneth A. Lint
LOUDONVILLE Kenneth A. Corky Lint, 69, of Loudonville, died Sunday (Jan. 20, 2002) in Samaritan Hospital in Ashland.
He was born July 25, 1932, in Glenmont, son of the late Foster and Helena Purdy Lint.
He was a Loudonville are resident most of his life. He owned and operated K&L Alignment since 1955.
In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by a brother, Ernest Doc Lint.
He leaves his wife, Lillian Christman Lint, whom he married April 5, 1968; two sons, Chad L. Lint of Loudonville and Kenny Allen Heffelfinger of Mansfield; two brothers, Gene Lint of Ashland and Wesley Gordon Lint of Loudonville; three sisters, Madeline Grennell of Mt. Vernon, Shirley Compton of Wooster and Judy Miller of Apple Creek.
Friends and family may call 6 to 8 p.m. Tuesday at Byerly-Lindsey Funeral Home in Loudonville, where services will be 11 a.m. Wednesday with the Rev. Howard Horton officiating.
Burial will be in Loudonville Cemetery.
 
Daily Jeff, January 21, 2002
Roman Spangler
WOODSFIELD Roman P. Spangler, 86, of Lewisville, died Sunday (Jan. 20, 2002) in the St. Joseph Hospice Center in Louisville.
He was born near Lewisville (Burkhart) on Dec. 28, 1915, son of the late Theodore and Philomena Kuhn Spangler.
He was a retired farmer and a member of St. Joseph Catholic Church near Lewisville.
In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by two brothers, Carl Spangler and Lewis Spangler.
He leaves two brothers, Herman Spangler of Canton and John Spangler of Sandusky; a sister, Mary Ann Spangler; and several nieces and nephews.
Friends and family may call 6 to 9 p.m. Tuesday at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield.
Mass of Christian burial will be celebrated at 11 a.m. Wednesday at St. Joseph Catholic Church with the Rev. Fr. David Gaydosik as celebrant.
Burial will be in St. Joseph Catholic Cemetery near Lewisville.
Vigil services will be 8 p.m. Tuesday at the funeral home.

Subject: Ernest "Ernie" Kirkbride
SOURCE: Daily Jeffersonian . . Cambridge, OH . . Jan 2002
Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
QUAKER CITY Ernest Ernie Kirkbride, 91, formerly of Quaker City, died Monday (Jan. 21, 2002) at Southeastern Med, Cambridge.
He was born May 26, 1910, in Belmont County, son of the late Ezra and Cora (Pittman) Kirkbride.
Mr. Kirkbride was a farmer and member of the East Main Street Church of Christ in Barnesville, and Seneca Valley Church.
He was a regular participant in local parades for many years, where he marched and played his harmonica.
He was preceded in death by two brothers, Isaac H. Kirkbride and Vernon Kirkbride; and a sister, Bessie Mayberry.
He leaves several nieces and nephews.
No calling hours will be observed. Graveside services and burial will be 2 p.m. Friday at Southern Cemetery, Somerton. Thorn-Black Funeral Home, Quaker City.
 
Canton Repository , January 23, 2002
Mary Alice Rubel
Mary Alice Rubel, age 96 of Canton, OH, passed away Monday evening in the Hanover House following an extended illness. Born in Barnesville, OH., on May 15, 1905, she was a former employee of the Westside Curtain Laundry in Canton. She was preceded in death by her parents, Lewis D. and Edwina Rubel; also by six sisters, Grace G. Schwartz, Mildred Haymaker, Viola Morrison, Amy Wilson, Dorothy Shook and Rose Barnes; and four brothers, Ben, George, Sam and Mancel Rubel. Survivors include two nephews and their spouses, Ralph R. and Genny Schwartz of Leetonia, OH, and Donald G. and Ginger Schwartz of Canton. There are several other nieces and nephews surviving. Private services and burial will be held Thursday at 11 a.m. in Forest Hill Cemetery with Rev. Raymond Tucker officiating. There will be no calling hours and the Reed Funeral Home is in charge of arrangements.
 
(Reed, 330-477-6721)

Daily Jeff, January 29, 2002
RUTH CLAUSS
WOODSFIELD Ruth M. Clauss, 78, of Jerusalem, died Sunday (Jan. 27, 2002) at Monroe County Care Center, Woodsfield.
She was born Sept. 17, 1923, in Akron, daughter of the late Burt and Ethel Mae (Menafee) Hershberger.
Mrs. Clauss was preceded in death by her husband, Robert George Clauss, on Feb. 5, 1996; and a son, Robert Clauss.
She leaves a daughter, Joyce Harris of Jerusalem; a son, Michael Clauss; four grandchildren and four great-grandchildren.
No calling hours will be observed.
Burial will be at the convenience of the family.

Daily Jeff, Jan 29, 2002
JOHN SPANGLER
WOODSFIELD John S. Spangler, 82, of the Ohio Veterans Home, Sandusky, formerly of Lewisville and Newbury, died Sunday (Jan. 27, 2002) at the home.
He was born June 8, 1919, in Lewisville, son of the late Theodore and Philomena (Kuhn) Spangler.
Mr. Spangler was a retired electrician and a member of St. Helen Catholic Church, Newbury.
He was a U.S. Army veteran, having served as corporal during World War II.
He was preceded in death by his wife, Maria T. (Gruber) Spangler, on Sept. 26, 1986; and three brothers, Carl Spangler, Lawrence Spangler and Roman Spangler.
He leaves two sons, Joseph Spangler of Newbury and Christopher Spangler of Chardon; a brother, Herman Spangler of Canton; and three grandchildren.
Friends may call from 9:30 to 10:30 a.m. Wednesday at Watters Funeral Home, Woodsfield.
Mass of Christian burial will be celebrated 11:30 a.m. Wednesday at St. Joseph Catholic Church near Lewisville, with the Rev. Father David Gaydosik serving as celebrant.
Burial will follow in St. Joseph Catholic Cemetery, near Lewisville.

Thursday, January 31, 2002 Marietta Times 
Marjorie M. Hogue
WOODSFIELD - Marjorie M. Hogue, 80, of 36920 Ohio 78, Woodsfield, died at 7:40 a.m. Wednesday (Jan. 30, 2002) at the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center in Woodsfield.
She was born Feb. 9, 1921, at Woodsfield to Vernon Maurice and Bertha Kinsey Nalley. She was a homemaker and was a member of the Woodsfield Church of Christ.
She is survived by two daughters, Bonnie Rothenbuhler of Cameron, Ohio, and Sharon Weber and her husband, Don, of Woodsfield; one son, Gailord Hogue and his wife, Laura, of Woodsfield; seven grandchildren; and 12 great-grandchildren.
She was preceded in death by her husband, Ellis E. Hogue, on June 18, 1999; her parents; two brothers, James Nalley and Melvin Nalley; and two grandsons, Jeffrey Hogue and Jon Garrett Hogue.
Services are at 11 a.m. Saturday at Watters Funeral Home, 37501 Ohio 78 West, Woodsfield, with Sam Bartrug officiating. Burial is in Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Friday at the funeral home.
 
2002X
William (Bill) Jacob Weber
Source:  Monroe County Beacon dated Thursday January 31, 2002
          William J. "Bill" Weber, Brooksville, FL. Died Jan 17 at Brooksville Hospice Center.  He was born June 20, 1920, in Lewisville, the son of William J. and Gertrude C Weber and grandson of the only village doctor in Lewisville.
          He was the owner and founder of the lighted house number which graces more than 300 homes in Brooksville and 15 states plus Canada.  As a young man, he was sent off to fight for his country during WW II.  He was assigned to the 65th Infantry Division of Patton's 3rd Army in Germany.  During his two year service to his country, Bill earned many medals including the Bronze Star, The Army Good Conduct Medal, the American Campaign Medal, the European Medal with two battle Stars, the WW II Occupation Medal German Bar.  He was an expert rifleman.
          Surviving are his wife of 63 years, Catherine; two daughters, Mrs. Robert (Shirley) Wittman, Raytown, MO, Mrs. Cotton (Bonnie) Stamford, Spring, Texas; two Granddaughters, Linda, Kansas City, MO, Angel Rychlik, Houston, Texas; great granddaughter, Jessica, Kansas City; two grandsons, Curtis and Matthew Samford, The Woodslands, Texas; three great-grandsons, Cody, Ty and Evan, The Woodslands.
          He was preceded in death by a son, William Junior; seven brothers and sisters.
          A celebration of Bill's life was held on Jan. 24 for friends and loved ones.  Burial was in Florida National Cemetery.
 
Saturday, February 02, 2002 - Marietta Times  XXXXX
Juanita M. Bigley
WOODSFIELD - Juanita M. Bigley, 79, of Monroe Manor, formerly of Graysville, died Friday (Feb. 1, 2002) at Marietta Memorial Hospital in Marietta.
She was born July 8, 1922, in Monroe County to George and Dora Mallett McConnell. She was a retired cook from the former Graysville Elementary School, where she worked for over 20 years. She was a member of the United Methodist church, Ladies Aid at Graysville and Graysville Fire Department Womens Auxiliary.
She is survived by one son, Kenneth Bigley and his wife, Jessie, of Marietta; two daughters, Sharon Robinson and her husband, Tom, of Woodsfield and Judy McConaughy and her husband, Mark, of Woodsfield; two sisters, Martha Morrison of Sycamore Valley and Freda Bewley of Stafford; five grandchildren, Brittany and Nathan McConaughy, Jason Bigley, and Mitchell and Michael Cliff; four step grandchildren; and five step great-grandchildren.
She was preceded in death by her husband, Preston Bigley, in November 1988; her parents; and one sister, Luna Franey.
Services are at 2 p.m. Sunday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, with the Rev. Dwaine Denis officiating. Burial is in Pleasants Ridge Cemetery near Graysville. Friends will be received from 2 to 5 and 7 to 9 p.m. Saturday at the funeral home.
Memorial contributions may be made to Woodsfield United Methodist Church, 136 N. Main St., Woodsfield, Ohio 43793.

Hazel Marie Steele, nee Farrabee
Source Monroe County Beacon Feb 7, 2002
          Hazel Marie Steele, 90, Barnesville, Formerly of Fairview and Somerton, died Feb. 2, 2002, at the Barnesville Health Care Center.  She was born Sept 11, 1911, in Beallsville, a daughter of the late Homer and Emily Weekley Farrabee.
          She was a Protestant by faith, a homemaker, mother and an avid quilter.
          Surviving are three sons, Bob and wife Sandra, Fairview, Roy and his wife Becky, Barnesville, Paul, Kimbolton; step-son, James Franklin and wife Dottie, Akron, step-daughter, Mary Belle Steele, Louisville, OH; step-daughters-in-law, Betty Steele, Orlando, FL and Peggy Steele, Cuyahoga Falls; 28 grandchildren; 46 great-grandchildren; six great-great-grandchildren; special friend, Mrs. Charles (Harriett) Whiteley, Fairview.
          In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her husband, Raymond Steele, on Oct 7, 1987, step-sons, John and Joe Steele; brother, Frank Farrabee; sister Mae Fitzgerald; grandson and great-granddaughter.
          Friends were received Feb 5 at Campbell-Plumley-Milburn Funeral Home, Barnesville, where services will be held February 6 at 1 p.m., with Pastor Rodney West officiating.  Burial will follow in Concord Cemetery, Centerville, OH

Lewis Harlan Hines
Source:  Monroe County Beacon dated Jan. 31, 2002
          Lewis Harlan Hines, 74, Park Hill Rd., Corbin, KY, died Jan. 22, 2002 at Baptist Regional Medical Center, He was born Nov. 21, 1927 at Graysville, a son of the late James Henry and Freda L. Hartshorn Hines.
          He was a member of the Brummett Church of Christ.  He was a retired press operator with National Cash Register Company having worked there for 40 years.  He was a devoted husband, father and grandfather and will be sadly missed by his family, friends and neighbors.
          Surviving are his wife, Mary Weddle Hines, Corbin, whom he married Aug. 5, 1955; son, Steven Lewis Hines, Corbin; two daughters, Gena F. Hines and Mrs. Brian (Sheia R. Hines) Baylor, all of Corbin; three brothers, Crawford Hines, Graysville, Marlin Hines, Canton, Carl Hines, Westerville; five grandchildren, Natalie Hines, Abby Baylor, Evan Baylor, Skyler Hines, Meggie Hines
          Friends were received Jan. 24 at Corbin Funeral Home, where funeral services were held Jan. 25, with Bro. Norman Webb officiating.  Burial in Pine Hill Cemetery.
 
Saturday, February 09, 2002 Marietta Times 
William Chester Cline
GRAYSVILLE - William Chester Cline, 83, of Ohio 26, Graysville, died Thursday (Feb. 7, 2002) at Camden-Clark Memorial Hospital in Parkersburg.
He was born Oct. 21, 1918, in Monroe County to William P. and Grace Beardmore Cline. He was a retired truck driver for the former Star Oil Co.
He was a Protestant by faith. He was a member of the Knowlton Covered Bridge Park Committee and a former member of the Monroe County Democratic Executive Committee and the Graysville Fire Department.
He was preceded in death by his wife, Opal Piatt Cline, in September 1991; his parents; an infant brother; and four sisters, Wilna Harmon, Thelma Buegel, Hilda Harmon and Dorothy Cline.
He is survived by one daughter, Rose Ann Lee and her husband, Floyd, of Graysville; three sisters, Eileen Knowlton, Maxine Knowlton and her husband, Harry, and Imogene Piatt, all of Graysville; one sister-in-law, Faye Piatt of Medina; one granddaughter, Jeanie Lee of Graysville; one great-granddaughter, Julie Hickman; one step granddaughter, Karen Shaw; three step great-grandchildren; one step great-great-grandchild; a special friend, Muriel Drayer of Beverly; and several nieces and nephews.
Services are at 2 p.m. Sunday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, with the Rev. Madlynne Webber and the Rev. George Hoskins officiating. Burial is in Low Gap Cemetery near Graysville. Friends will be received from 2 to 9 p.m. Saturday at the funeral home.

Minnie Columbia Luburgh, nee Needs
Source:  Monroe County Beacon dated February 7, 2002
Minnie C. Luburgh, 102, 315 Guilford Ave., Woodsfield, formerly of 107 North Paul St., Woodsfield, died Jan. 29, 2002, in the Monroe County Care Center, Woodsfield. She was born near Caldwell, Crum Ridge, on March 11, 1899, a daughter of the late Andrew H. and Mary Spence Needs.
She was a homemaker and a member of the Woodsfield Church of Christ in Woodsfield.
She had enjoyed sewing and crocheting and especially enjoyed her family.
Surviving are three daughters, Ruth Camden, Woodsfield, Mrs. Charles W. (Ruby) Martin, Mrs. Edwin  (Virginia) Devore, Jacksonville, FL; nine grandchildren; 17 great-grandchildren; 17 great-great-grandchildren.
In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her husband, James Carlos Luburgh on Dec. 24, 1969; a daughter, Betty June Luburgh; son, James Richard Luburgh; five sisters, Dora Oldham, Iona Wharton, Pearl House, Florence Luke, Fanchion Marker; brother Roy Weeds; grandson, James Wilbert Martin; great-great-grandson, Nathan Michael Norman; son-in-law, Robert G. "Bud" Camden.
Friends were received at Watters Funeral Home, Woodsfield, Feb. 1, where funeral services were held Feb. 2,with Sam Bartrug officiating. Burial followed in Oaklawn Cemetery, Woodsfield.
Memorial contributions may be made to the Woodsfield Church of Christ, Benevolent
Fund, 860 Lewisville Rd., Woodsfield, OH 43793.

Monday, February 11, 2002, Marietta Times
Edna A. Haren
WOODSFIELD - Edna A. Haren, 93, of South Sycamore Street died Saturday (Feb. 9, 2002) at Barnesville Hospital.
She was born Sept. 17, 1908, in Noble County to George and Gertrude Retterbeck Crum. She was a member of St. Sylvester Catholic Church at Woodsfield and the Catholic Women's Club.
She is survived by several nieces and nephews.
She was preceded in death by her husband, Clem Haren, in 1965; six sisters, Mary Himmerling, Mitilda Kullman, Emma Haren, Blach Nauer, Cora Michel and Estella Sebold; and four brothers, Lewis, Raymond, Urban and Harry Crum.
Mass of Christian burial is at 11 a.m. today at St. Sylvester Catholic Church at Woodsfield with Father David Gaydosik officiating. Burial is in St. Sylvester Catholic Church Cemetery. Bauer-Turner Funeral Home in Woodsfield is in charge of arrangements.

2002
 
Orange, Wilbert H.
SOURCE: Times Recorder . . . Zanesville, OH . . Feb 2002
Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
ZANESVILLE -- Wilbert H. Orange, 95, of Zanesville, Ohio died at 1:05 p.m. Thursday, Feb. 14, 2002 at Genesis Hospice, Morrison House.
Mr. Orange was born Sept. 24, 1906, at Monroe County, the son of the late Leonard and Nellie Wallace Orange. He was a retired cost accountant at the former McGraw Edison Co., a member of the Norval Park Church of Christ, and an Army Veteran of World War II.
Surviving are a sister, Gertrude Fountain of Zanesville, and eight nieces.
Besides his parents, he was preceded in death by his wife, Eva L. Orange, who died Nov. 26, 1996; a sister, Olive Kellow; and a brother, Flavil L. Orange.
Calling hours will be 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m. today at the Bolin Funeral Home, 1271 Blue Ave., with funeral services at 1 p.m. Saturday with Evangelist Dallas Lockhart officiating. Burial will follow at Zanesville Memorial Park.
 
 
Marietta Times
Friday, February 15, 2002
William R. 'Billy Ray' Graham
WOODSFIELD - William R. "Billy Ray" Graham, 48, of 215 1/2 S. Paul St. died at 3:28 a.m. Wednesday (Feb. 13, 2002) at Ohio State University Hospital in Columbus.
He was born June 19, 1953, in Cambridge to Pastor William G. and Wanda King Graham. He had attended the Church of the Nazarene in Woodsfield.
He is survived by two daughters, Stephanie Goddard and her husband, Michael, of Sardis, and Tiffany Rene Graham of Stark County, Ohio; his parents; two brothers, David Graham and his wife, Cindy, and Randy Graham and his wife, Tammy, both of Woodsfield; two grandsons, Jesse Goddard and Jacob Goddard, both of Sardis; three nieces; and two nephews.
Services are at 11 a.m. Saturday at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield with Pastor David Langdon officiating. Burial is in Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. today at the funeral home.
 
2002 OOOOO
Philipp Brubach
April 24, 1917 - February 17, 2002
Birthplace: Austria-Hungary
Resided In: Mansfield Ohio USA
Funeral Home: Diamond Street Home of Wappner Funeral Directors More Info/Directions
Visitation: February 19, 2002 More Info/Directions
Service: February 20, 2002 More Info/Directions
Cemetery: Mansfield Cemetery More Info/Directions
Philipp Burbach, 84, of Mansfield died Sunday morning, February 17, 2002, at his home after an extended illness. Mr. Burbach was born April 24, 1917, in Austria-Hungary to Georg and Theresia (Betsch) Burbach. He was a Mansfield resident since 1952 and worked as a concrete finisher with Mansfield Flooring until his retirement. Philipp was a member of Holy Trinity Lutheran Church and enjoyed working with his hands, spending time with his family and had quite a sense of humor.
Left to cherish his memory are his wife of 52 years, Maria (Kreilach) Burbach; two sons and a daughter-in-law, Reinhold & Debbie Burbach and Walter Burbach; two daughters and sons-in-law, Linda & Kenneth Westfield and Rosemarie & Neil Lindhout; three grandchildren, Kendra & Geoff Newland, Christina Lindhout and Sabrina Lindhout; two step-grandchildren, Ken & Amy Westfield and Steve & Sara Westfield; step-great-granddaughter, Anna Westfield; and sister, Katharina Burbach. He was preceded in death by his parents, Georg & Theresia Burbach, two brothers, Georg and Andreas Burbach, and three sisters, Rosina Schmidt, Julianna Tempelfield, and Elisabeth Burbach.
Friends may call at the Diamond Street Home of Wappner Funeral Directors, Tuesday, February 19, 2002 from 4-8 p.m. Funeral services will be at Holy Trinity Lutheran Church, Wednesday at 1:00 p.m. conducted by Dr. Wray C. Smith. Burial will follow in Mansfield Cemetery. In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions may be made to MedCentral Hospice.

Monday, February 18, 2002, Marietta Times
Nellie G. Anderson
GRAYSVILLE - Nellie G. Anderson, 92, of Graysville died Saturday (Feb. 16, 2002) at the Woodsfield Nursing & Rehabilitation Center.
She was born Aug. 15, 1909, in Monroe County to Charles and Hannah Sloan Anderson. She was a member of the Pleasant Ridge Church of Christ.
She is survived by one sister, Nettie Martin of Sycamore Valley; one sister-in-law, Myra Anderson of Graysville; and several nieces and nephews.
She was preceded in death by her parents; four sisters, Lila Rinard, Daisy Weckbacher, Anna Frank and Georgia Anderson; and five brothers, Ora Anderson, Denver Anderson, Cars Anderson, Luther Anderson and an infant brother, George Hessie Anderson.
Services are at 11 a.m. Wednesday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, with Minister Harold Kinney officiating. Burial is in Pleasant Ridge Cemetery near Graysville. Friends will be received from 6 to 8 p.m. Tuesday at the funeral home.
 
 
Saturday, February 23, 2002,X
The Marietta Times
Darlene A. Kilburn
LEWISVILLE - Darlene A. Kilburn, 42, of 48954 Ohio 145, Lewisville, died Thursday (Feb. 20, 2002) near Lewisville.
She was born Aug. 7, 1959, in Cambridge to Francis and Mary Agnes Ritterbeck Weisend. She was a 1977 graduate of Shenandoah High School at Sarahsville, Ohio. She was a technician for Cartridge Source at Graysville and was a member of St. Joseph Catholic Church near Lewisville.
She is survived by her husband, Stephen Kilburn, whom she married Oct. 28, 1978; one daughter, Brandi Kilburn and her fianceˇ', Ryan Loch, at home; one son, Preston Kilburn at home; one sister, Diann Jennings of New Carlisle, Ohio; one brother, Duane Weisend and his wife, Judy, of Summerfield; one stepsister, Alice Bond and her husband, Doug, of Carlisle; three stepbrothers, Dale Feldner and his wife, Kay, and Melvyn Feldner, all of Carlisle, and Mark Feldner and his wife, Angie, of Belle Valley, Ohio; her stepmother, Ethel Weisend of Jacksontown, Ohio; her father-in-law and mother-in-law, Don and Judy Kilburn of Lewisville; her special friend, Barb Smith of Geneva, Ohio; and several nieces, nephews, great-nieces and great-nephews.
Mass of Christian burial will be concelebrated at 11 a.m. Monday at St. Mary's Immaculate Conception Catholic Church in Fulda with the Rev. David Gaydosik and the Rev. Samuel R. Saprano officiating. Burial is in St. Mary's Catholic Cemetery at Fulda.
Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Sunday at Watters Funeral Home, Ohio 78 West, Woodsfield. Vigil services are at 8 p.m. Sunday at the funeral home.
 
Monday, February 25, 2002 Marietta Times   XXXXX
Charles R. McConnell
STAFFORD - Charles R. McConnell, 75, of 42304 Mill St. died at 10:48 p.m. Friday (Feb. 22, 2002) at Marietta Memorial Hospital in Marietta.
He was born Dec. 22, 1926, near Stafford to William Floyd and Ollie Mae Gildow McConnell. He was a retired employee of the former B.F. Goodrich Co. at Marietta. He was a Protestant by faith. He was a 50-year member of Stafford Lodge 300, Free and Accepted Masons, and a member of Huffman Grange. He enjoyed NASCAR racing and golfing in his spare time.
He is survived by one brother, Lewis G. McConnell and his wife, Ruth, of Lewisville; two nephews, Rex McConnell and his wife, Linda, of Lower Salem and Phil McConnell and his wife, Misty, of Lewisville; one niece, Donna Weddle and her husband, Danny, of Lewisville; three great-nephews, Bryan McConnell, Eddie McConnell and Darrell Weddle; three great-nieces, Danielle Weddle, Darlene Weddle and Ellen McConnell; several cousins; and two aunts.
He was preceded in death by his parents and one brother, John C. McConnell.
Services are at 11 a.m. Tuesday at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield with the Rev. Bill Pickenpaugh officiating. Burial is in Stafford Cemetery at Stafford. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. today at the funeral home. Masonic services are at 8 p.m. today at the funeral home.
 
 
Clauss, Ruth M.

2002
Smith, Alfred Elmo Smith
SOURCE: The Daily Jeffersonian . . Cambridge, OH . . Jan 2002
Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
BARNESVILLE Alfred Elmo Smith, 68, of Barnesville, died Tuesday (Jan. 29, 2002) at his home.
He was born Nov. 29, 1933, in Temperanceville, son of the late Lawrence Edwin and Mary Ann (Pekarie) Smith.
Mr. Smith was a member of St. Mary s Catholic Church, VFW Post 2792, Batesville American Legion, Amvets of Derwent, Elks Lodge 1699, Loyal Order of Moose of Barnesville, and FOE of Woodsfield.
He was a U.S. Marine Corps veteran, having served in the Korean War. He was owner of Starrs Carryout and Grocery in Calais.
He was preceded in death by his first wife, Una M. (Starr) Smith.
He leaves his wife, Barbara (Powell) Leach Smith; three sons, Tyson (Anne) Smith of Calais, Terry (Sandy) Smith of Barnesville, and Tim (Chrissy) Smith of Middlebourne; a step-son, Darrell (Debbie) Leach of Summerfield; three step-daughters, Mrs. Junior (Darla) Wehr of Bethesda, Mrs. Jeff (Donna) Wray and Danielle Leach, both of Summerfield; two brothers, Edwin Bonnie Smith of Concord, Calif., and Lawrence Sonny Smith of Clarington; four sisters, Genevieve Gallagher, Charlotte Smith and Helen Smith, all of Barnesville, and Betty Allar of Cambridge; and 13 grandchildren.
Friends may call from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Thursday at Campbell-Plumly-Milburn Funeral Home, Barnesville, where services will be 11 a.m. Friday with the Rev. William Pickenpaugh officiating. VFW Post 2792 will conduct services at 6:45 p.m. Thursday at the funeral home.
Burial will be in Calais Cemetery. Full military honors will be conducted by Belmont County Veterans Council.
Memorial contributions may be made to Hospice of Guernsey, P.O. Box 1165, 9711 East Pike, Cambridge, OH 43725.
 
 
 
Monday, February 25, 2002 Marietta Times 
 
Jerry 'Jed' L. Sims
WOODSFIELD - Jerry "Jed" L. Sims, 62, of Woodsfield died Saturday (Feb. 23, 2002) at Barnesville Hospital.
He was born Sept. 28, 1939, in Woodsfield to Gerald and Kathryn Simmons Sims. He was a retired employee of Ormet Corp. at Hannibal, with 33 years of service. He was a U.S. Air Force veteran. He was a member of Woodsfield Church of Christ at Woodsfield, Veterans of Foreign Wars, Fraternal Order of Eagles and Loyal Order of Moose Lodge.
He is survived by his wife of 40 years, Mary Ann Meek Sims; three sons, Russell L. Sims and his wife, Maria, of Columbus, Daniel G. Sims and his wife, Darlene, of Woodsfield and Richard A. Sims and his wife, Suzanne, of Fort Myers, Fla.; one sister, Kathy Stalnaker of West Virginia; three brothers, William Sims and his wife, Charlene, of Woodsfield, Philip Sims and his wife, Becky, of Woodsfield and Robert Sims of Woodsfield; five grandchildren, Erica, Lauren, Tyler, Zachary and Jerrett; and several nieces and nephews.
He was preceded in death by his parents and one brother, John Wiley.
Services are at 11 a.m. Wednesday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, with Keith Jones officiating. Burial is in Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield. Friends will be received from 1 to 9 p.m. Tuesday at the funeral home.
Memorial contributions may be made to the Woodsfield Little League, in care of Regina Eddy, 51453 Ohio 145, Jerusalem, Ohio 43747, to establish a fund for new bleachers.

Thursday, March 07, 2002 -Marietta Times  XXXXX
Amy R. McLane (nee Rice)
WOODSFIELD - Amy R. McLane, 86, of Berkley Drive died Wednesday (March 6, 2002) at the Monroe County Care Center in Woodsfield.
She was born March 2, 1916, in Belmont County, Ohio, to Harry and Blanche Inghram Rice. She and her husband were former co-owners of the Woodsfield Greenhouse. She was a member of the United Methodist Church of Woodsfield and United Methodist Women, and was active in many community organizations.
She is survived by one son, Allan McLane and his wife, Marcia, of Dublin, Ohio; two daughters, Linda Kay Taylor and her husband, Charles, and Judy Schwall and her husband, Gary, all of Woodsfield; one brother, Harry Rice Jr. of Wheeling, W.Va.; four grandchildren, Christopher Taylor, Douglas Taylor, Tammie Highman and Tye Schwall; and four great-grandchildren, Logan, Marissa, Jordan and Ryanna Taylor.
She was preceded in death by her husband, William Clifford McLane, who died in April 1994; her parents; and two brothers, Cecil and Clarence Rice.
Services are at 1 p.m. Saturday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield. Burial is in Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Friday at the funeral home.
Memorial contributions may be made to the United Methodist Church, 136 N. Main St., Woodsfield, Ohio 43793; or a charity of the donor's choice.

Craig, Sarah Elizabeth (Grimes)
SOURCE: Marietta Times . . . Marietta, OH . . Mar 2002
Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
RINARD MILLS - Sarah Elizabeth Craig, 99, of Rinard Mills died at 12:15 a.m. Thursday (March 7, 2002) at Harmar Place in Marietta.
She was born March 7, 1903, in Ellenboro, W.Va., to Joseph and Lucinda Wince Grimes. She was a homemaker and a member of Rinard Mills Methodist Church.
She is survived by one son, Joseph H. Craig and his wife, Maxine, of Rinard Mills; two grandsons, Russ Craig and his wife, Patty, of Nokesville, Va., and Jeff Craig and his wife, Holly, of Cincinnati; two great-grandchildren; and two sisters, Lorena Jordan, of Reno and Flora Ward, of Mineral Wells, W.Va.
On May 15, 1923, she married Bernard Austin Craig. He died June 6, 1985. She was also preceded in death by her parents; three brothers, Ted, Harry and Hosie Grimes; and four sisters, Mattie Say, Blanche Haddox, Letha Grimes and Bessie Karcher.
Services will be held at the convenience of the family at Hadley Funeral Home, New Matamoras. Burial is in Rinard Mills Cemetery. The family will receive friends from 6 to 8 p.m. Monday at the funeral home.

Jones, Audrey Hazel ( Thomas )
SOURCE: Marietta Times . . . Marietta, OH . . .Mar 2002
Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
RINARD MILLS - Audrey Hazel Jones, 96, of Ohio 260, Rinard Mills, died at 4:20 a.m. Sunday (March 10, 2002) at Marietta Memorial Hospital.
She was born Oct. 17, 1905, in Bloomfield, Ohio, to David Everett and Ida Mae Hupp Thomas. She was a homemaker and a member of Muskingum Valley Baptist Church. She was an honorary member of Muskingum Valley Missionary Society and a member of American Legion Auxiliary 378 at New Matamoras.
She is survived by two sons, Paul E. Jones and his wife, Ruth, of Marietta and David Warren Jones of Rinard Mills; five grandchildren; three great-grandchildren; and two great-great-granddaughters.
On Nov. 5, 1930, she married Ernest Dwight Jones in Marietta. He died June 18, 1980. She was also preceded in death by her parents; two sons, Bobby William and Franklin Eugene Jones; and one great-grandchild.
Services are at 2 p.m. Wednesday at Hadley Funeral Home, New Matamoras, with the Rev. Marvin Haught officiating. Burial is in Muskingum Valley Cemetery. The family will receive friends from 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m. Tuesday at the funeral home.

2002
Love, Ronald L. "Ronnie"
SOURCE: Marietta Times . . Marietta, OH . . Mar 2002 . .
Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
LOWER SALEM - Ronald L. "Ronnie" Love, 66, of Lower Salem, Harrietsville community, died Tuesday morning (March 12, 2002) at Marietta Memorial Hospital.
He was born Oct. 16, 1935, in Elk Township to James H. and Ollie Blanche Craven Love.
He graduated from Elk Local High School in 1953. He retired in August 2001, after 39 years of service, from B&N Coal. He was a former employee of General Motors in Columbus, Brickwede Brothers in Marietta, and the state highway department in Caldwell. He was a veteran, serving with the Ohio National Guard as a Specialist 5th Class in the 112th Medical Battalion for three years and one year with the Automatic Weapons Division.
He was a member of Stafford Church of Christ. He loved NASCAR racing and was a Dale Earnhardt fan. He had a deep appreciation of guns and enjoyed fishing.
He was preceded in death by his parents; an infant son; his father-in-law, Virgil H. Cunningham; one brother-in-law, Richard E. Cunningham; and a brother-in-law and sister-in-law, James H. and Martha Cunningham.
He is survived by his wife, Norma Faye Cunningham Love, whom he married Nov. 11, 1956; three daughters, Debra S. (Roger) Haney of Lewisville, Lisa A. Love at home, and Stacy L. (Chris) of Dimmerling of Lower Salem; four sons, Michael C. (Carol) Love of Lower Salem, J. Douglas (Lucinda) Love of Lower Salem, Mitchell L. (Lisa) Love of Florence, S.C., and R. Landon (Charity) Love of Lower Salem; 10 grandchildren, Lee Andrew and Shanaka D. Haney, Dustin C., Alicia M., Leeanna M., Joshua J., Jennifer R., Kyle H., and Joseph C. Love, and Gracye N. Dimmerling; one brother, Larry L. (Becky) Love of Senecaville; his mother-in-law, Marjorie Cunningham of Lower Salem; a sister-in-law, Mary Ellen Cunningham of Marietta; four aunts, Margie (Don) Bishop and Mary (Don) Wenzel of Marietta, Myrtle Hardesty of Caldwell and Vietta Williams of Woodsfield; and several nieces, nephews and cousins.
Services are at 1 p.m. Friday at McVay-Perkins Funeral Home in Caldwell with the Rev. Kevin Rinkes and the Rev. Linda O'Donnell officiating. Burial is in Stewart Cemetery in Lower Salem. Friends may call from 7 to 9 p.m. today at the funeral home

Friday, March 15, 2002 Marietta Times
Eunice J. Hamilton
WOODSFIELD - Eunice J. Hamilton, 82, of 803 Monroe Manor died at 8:05 a.m. Thursday (March 14, 2002) at the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center in Woodsfield.
She was born Feb. 24, 1920, near Woodsfield to Thomas and Evaline Wohnhas Hamilton. She was a retired restaurant worker in Columbus and was a member of the Woodsfield Church of Christ in Woodsfield.
She is survived by five sisters, Laura Bach of Lewisville, Gertrude Hamilton and Goldia Hamilton, both of Woodsfield, Geneva Lyons of Columbus, and Sarah Kreig of Sardis; two brothers, Horace Hamilton of Zanesville and Neil Hamilton of Woodsfield; and several nieces and nephews.
She was preceded in death by her parents; and three brothers, Vernon Hamilton, Oscar Hamilton and Thomas Hamilton.

Marietta Times Saturday, March 16, 2002
Francis J. Burkhart
WOODSFIELD - Francis J. Burkhart, 90, of 33473 Walter Ridge Road died Thursday (March 14, 2002) at Barnesville Hospital in Barnesville.
He was born Dec. 28, 1911, in Calais, Ohio, to Clemence J. and Rebecca Stephens Burkhart. He was a retired truck driver. He was a member of St. John the Baptist Catholic Church at Miltonsburg, Ohio. He was a World War II U.S. Army veteran. He was a member of Barnesville Veterans of Foreign Wars Post 2792 at Barnesville.
He is survived by his wife, Helen Crum Crock Burkhart, whom he married July 31, 1975; three stepdaughters, Hazel May of Beallsville, Linda Swallie of Barnesville and Wilma Burkhart of Woodsfield; one stepson, Robert Crock of Massillon; four sisters, Lilly Mercer of Barnesville, Edna Tepley of East Lake, Ohio, Audrey Carpenter of Zanesville and Luzelda Stephens of St. Clairsville; 20 step grandchildren; several step great-grandchildren; two step great-grandsons; and several nieces and nephews.
He was preceded in death by his parents; one stepdaughter, Betty Doty; one sister, Virginia Kimble; and two brothers, Everett Burkhart and Joseph Burkhart.
Mass of Christian burial will be celebrated at 11 a.m. Monday at St. John the Baptist Catholic Church in Miltonsburg with Father David Gaydosik as celebrant. Burial is in St. John the Baptist Catholic Cemetery with full military graveside services conducted by the Belmont Veterans Council of the V.F.W.
Friends will be received from 2 to 8 p.m. Sunday at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield. Vigil services are at 7:30 p.m. Sunday at the funeral home.

Willard Edwin 'Bid' McConnell XXXXX
WOODSFIELD - Willard Edwin "Bid" McConnell, 59, of Ohio 800, Woodsfield, died Wednesday (March 20, 2002) at his home.
He was born April 9, 1942, in Woodsfield to Edwin and Vera Ault McConnell. He was retired from the Conalco Aluminum Plant in Hannibal, Ohio, and was a U.S. Army veteran. He was a member of the Woodsfield Church of Christ, National Rifle Association and National Wild Turkey Federation.
He is survived by his wife, Linda Sue Freitag McConnell; one son, Brent McConnell of Antioch, Ohio; one daughter, Melissa McConnell Dunphy of Independence, Ky.; two brothers, Wayne McConnell of Columbus and Dale McConnell of Washington, Pa.; two sisters, Darlene Werner of Decatur, Ala., and Sharon Harris of New Concord; and four grandchildren, Amanda and Morgan McConnell and Ryley and Nolan Dunphy.

Death
Donald L. Young,
Donald L. Young, 56, Pataskala, died unexpectedly March 23, 2002, at his home. He was born in Monroe County, September 12, 1945. a son of the late Lewis and Margaret Schaub Young.
He was a former Reynoldsburg resident for 22 year, worked for 16 years at Western Electric/ATT&T, currently employed by General electric Super Abrasives, and served 6 years in the United states army Reserves.
Surviving are his wife of 33 years, Bonnie Decker Young; three sons, Brent, Chad, and Chris; three grandchildren, Devan, Taylor, and Taygan; brother Bob and his wife Eleanor Young; two sisters, Mrs. Glen Stalder (Juanita) and Mrs. Mark (Sue) Martinka.

2002
Anne Christman
January 24, 1910 - March 26, 2002
Birthplace: Toledo, Ohio
Resided In: Youngstown Ohio USA
Funeral Home: Lane Funeral Home Canfield Chapel More Info/Directions
Visitation: None
Service: April 02, 2002 More Info/Directions
Cemetery: Bloomville Cemetery More Info/Directions
Funeral services will be held at 11:00 AM Tuesday, April 2nd at Canfield Presbyterian Church for Anne K. Christman of Canfield who passed away Tuesday morning at Park Vista Retirement Community.
Mrs. Christman was born January 24, 1910 in Toledo, Ohio the daughter of Wiliam H. and Mattie (Martin) Kilcawley and moved to Youngstown in 1916.
Anne graduated from The Rayen School and and Lake Erie College in Painesville. She was a Trustee of the Lake Erie College where Kilcawley Hall was named after her father and the Christman boardroom was named for Anne. She was a member of the board at The Mahoning Valley Historical Society, the Butler Museum of American Art, The Stambaugh Auditorium Board, and the Park Vista Retirement Community Board of Directors. She was also a member of the board of the Stancorp Company, the Watson Foundation, and The MillCreek Child Care Center.
Anne was also a member of the Jr. Wemodaughsis Club of Canfield, The Mahoning Chapter of D.A.R., the Canfield Historical Society, and the Pillars of Stambaugh Auditorium. Anne was a member of the Board of Trustees at Canfield Presbyterian Church.
Kilcawley Center at Y.S.U is named after her father and Christman Commons, also at Y.S.U. named after Anne.
She leaves a cousin Jean A. McFadden of Youngstown as well as several nieces and nephews. She was preceded in death by her husband Byron whom she married June 5, 1937 and passed away February 15, 1983.
Memorial tributes may be sent to the donor s favorite charity.
There are no calling hours.
 
2002
Witten, Marjorie Frances ( Bradfield)
SOURCE: Times Recorder . . . . Zanesville, OH . . . Mar 2002
Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
MARIETTA -- Marjorie Frances Witten, 82, died Monday, March 25, 2002, surrounded by family at her home.
Born Sept. 26, 1919, in Monroe County, she was a daughter of Sam and Lydia Bradfield.
She married Ralph Witten on Dec. 16, 1942, in Ravenna, where they both worked at the time. She was the Matriarch of the Witten Farms market of Beverly and she and her husband started farming on the Ohio River near Fly. In 1958, they moved their business and their children to the present location near Beverly.
Her husband, Ralph, of 59 years survives. Also surviving are five daughters, Carol Witten of Richmond, Calif., Barbara (Roger) Schaad of Beverly, Sue (Rick) Whitacre of Zanesville, Polly Ann (Larry) Campbell of Lowell and Debbie (Marty) Witten Dematteis of Jamestown, Pa.; two sons, Jerry (Bonnie) Witten of Lowell and Ralph Witten Jr. of Lowell; seven grandsons; three granddaughters; two great-granddaughters; and two great-grandsons.
Visitation is 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m. Wednesday at McClure-Schafer-Lankford Funeral Home in Marietta.
Services will be held at 2:30 p.m. Thursday at the funeral home with the Rev. Zack Waite officiating. Burial will be in East Lawn Memorial Park.

MARIETTA TIMES,
Tuesday, MARCH 26, 2002
Zwick

Marietta Times - March 28, 2002 XXXXX
Nina Martin Beardmore
Nina Martin Beardmore, 85, of 1003 Glendale Road, Marietta, died Wednesday (March 27, 2002) at her home.
She was born Sept. 21, 1916, in Monroe County to Edward and Lela Whitacre Martin. She had lived in Marietta most of her life. She was a member of First Congregational United Church of Christ, the Dana Class and Order of Eastern Star Chapter 59 at Marietta. She enjoyed cross stitching, cooking and being around her family.
She is survived by one son, Jeffrey Beardmore and his wife, Lynn, of Fleming; one granddaughter, Sarah Beardmore of Fleming; one brother, Wilbert Martin and his wife, Ruby, of Woodsfield; and numerous nieces and nephews.
She was preceded in death by her husband, Clarence E. Beardmore, on Sept. 16, 1982. They had been married on Nov. 24, 1938. She was also preceded in death by one daughter, Karen Beardmore; and two sisters, Schammie Johnson and Elizabeth Lindamood.
Services are at 1 p.m. Saturday at First Congregational Church with the Reverend Linda Steelman officiating. Burial is in Valley Cemetery. Friends may call from 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m. Friday at the Marietta Chapel of Cawley & Peoples Funeral Home and for one hour prior to the service Saturday at the church.
Memorial contributions may be made to the Memorial Fund at First Congregational Church, 318 Front St., Marietta, Ohio 45750.

Barbara Ann Smith
Source:  Monroe County Beacon dated March 28, 2002:
          Barbara A. Smith, 72, West Maple Ave., Geneva Twp. died Feb. 28, 2002, at her home.  She was born Nov. 20, 19929, in Willoughby, a daughter of the late Keston and Stella Weber Wahl Brigham.  She had lived in Geneva Twp. for the past three years, previously living 30 years on River Glen Drive, Austinburg Twp.
          She was a graduate of Rock Creek High School.
          Surviving are two daughters, Dianna M. Patterson, Jackson Center, Pa., S. Barbara Schultz, Geneva; three grandchildren, Dalynne Sanborn, and Eric and Scott Schultz; two great-grand-children; three brothers, Corliss H. "Cork" Brigham, Eagleville, Roy C. Brighham, Portsmouth, N.H. and John C. Brigham, Eliot, Main; sister, Carrol J. Gildersleeve, Austinburg Twp.
          In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her husband, George Laverne 'Pete' Smith. Lewisville, in 1998 whom she married April 30, 1949 in Woodsfield; three brothers, Keston, Jr., Elmer and Linn Brigham; tow sisters, Velda Grandbouche, Lois Timms.
          Services were held March 4 at Fleming Funeral Home, Jefferson, with Rev. Bill McMinn of Eaglesville Bible Church officiating.  Burial in Eagleville Cemetery.
          Memorial contributions may be made to the American Heart Association, P.O. Box 182039, Dept. 013, Columbus, OH 43218
 
Columbus Dispatch - March 29, 2002
DUTT Merle (Johnson) Dutt, passed away Thursday, March 28, 2002. Mrs. Dutt was born in Indianapolis, IN, the eldest child of Charles and Nora (Blackwell) Johnson. Merle attended Butler University and Capital University School of Music. She was preceded in death by her husband Dr. Harold Dutt in 1978, her parents and brothers Glenn and Charles (Chic). She is survived by her foster daughter, Ida Lou McDaniel; nieces, Mimi (Daniel) Tucker, Janet (Neil) Kinley; several other nieces, nephews, great-nieces, great-nephews and many precious friends. Funeral service 11 a.m. Tuesday, April 2, 2002, at Cypress Wesleyan Church, 377 Alton-Darby Creek Rd., Galloway. Pastors Theron Smith, Dale George, Robert Iddings and Daniel Tucker officiating. Interment at Alton Cemetery. The family will receive friends on Monday, from 6-9 p.m. at the SCHOEDINGER HILLTOP CHAPEL, 3030 W. Broad St., Columbus and one hour prior to service at the church. Go to SCHOEDINGER.COM to send letters of sympathy to the family.
 
Columbus Dispatch - March 25, 2002
YOUNG Donald L. Young, age 56 of Pataskala, passed away unexpectedly Saturday, March 23, 2002, at his home. He was a former Reynoldsburg resident for 22 years, worked for 16 years at Western Electric/AT&T, currently employed by General Electric Super Abrasives, and served 6 years in the U.S. Army Reserve. He is preceded in death by his parents Lewis and Margaret Young. He is survived by his wife of 33 years, Bonnie; sons, Brent, Chad and Chris Young; grandchildren, Devan, Taylor, and Taygan; brother, Bob (Eleanor) Young; sisters, Juanita (Glen) Stalder and Sue (Mark) Martinka. His family will receive friends Tuesday 2-4 and 6-8 p.m. at the COTNER FUNERAL HOME, 7369 East Main Street, Reynoldsburg, where his service will be Wednesday at 11:30 a.m.
 
2002 XXXXX
Francis O."Jack" Matson, Jr. (August 10,1943 - March 28, 2002)
A funeral service for Francis O. "Jack" Matson, Jr., 58, of Buckeye Lake, will be held at 7p.m. today at Criss-Schoedinger Funeral Chapel with pastor Bob Perdue officiating. Burial will follow at a later date in Newark Memorial Gardens.
Mr. Matson died March 28, 2002, at Selma Markowitz Hospice care center. He was born Aug.10, 1943, in Troy, to the late Francis O. Matson Sr. and Mary Elizabeth (Wilson) Hosmer.
Mr. Matson worked at Diebold, Inc. For 28 years.  He served in the navy in the 1960's, and was a member of the CWA-AFL-CIO local #84710.
Mr. Matson is survived by his wife of 28 years, Betty I. (Lendon) Matson of Buckeye Lake, whom he married August 9, 1973; second mother, Lorene (Williams) Matson of Newark; daughters Janet Lynn Matson of Clearwater, Fla., Estelle Belle Booth  of Buckeye Lake, Patricia Irene Showalter of Hanover and Rita Renee Dolan of Newark; sons Jonathan Douglas Matson of Hilliard, Jason Alan Matson of Dayton, James Francis Hall Matson , James Mansel Kurtz Jr. of Buckeye Lake, Jerome Michael Kurtz of Delaware, and Jeffrey Manuel Kurtz of Delaware; sisters Janot Arlene Fitch of Louisa, KY, Lois Jean Derr of Bradford, Sandra Jo Wright of Newark and Rosemary Mees of Sidney; brothers , David C. Matson of Corpus Christi, Texas, John Hosmer of Pemberton and Chris Johnson of Dayton; and numerous grandchildren and great-grandchildren.
In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by his brother, Dale Matson.
Friends may call from 5 to 7 p.m. today at the funeral home, 179 Granville St. Newark.   
 
March 31, 2002X
Canton Repository
Christopher Kahrig family
Applause Grieving family thankful for help
There are no words that adequately express our feelings. The tragic loss of our family in the fire on New Year s Day has devastated us.
We would like to take this time to express our sincere appreciation for the wonderful outpouring of support, prayers, cards, flowers and monetary donations that have come from the Brewster and surrounding communities. Everyone has come together to help us through this tragedy, and you are all greatly appreciated.
We would like to give a special thank-you for the assistance provided by the following: Brewster, Bethlehem, Beach City, Massillon, North Lawrence, Plain and Wilmot fire departments; and American Medical Response, Stark Ambulance, Massillon Community Hospital, Doctors Hospital, Children s Hospital Medical Center of Akron, Stanwood Cemetery Organization, Reed Funeral Home, Wal-Mart, Sam s Club, Belloni Foods, 38th Street Church of Christ, and Schumacher Homes.
We would also like to thank everyone who attended the calling hours and funeral services. Your support meant so much to us. Please continue to keep us in your prayers.
THE KAHRIG FAMILY
 
DAILY JEFF - APRIL 1, 2002XXXXX
Beulah J. Byers
WOODSFIELD Beulah J. Byers, 83, of Trail Run Community, New Matamoras, died Saturday (March 30, 2002) at the Ohio State University Hospital in Columbus.
She was born Aug. 2, 1918, in Monroe County, a daughter of the late Joseph and Estella Rosenlieb Frobish.
She was a retired bus driver for the Switzerland of Ohio School District, a member of the St. Paul s Church at Trail Run, the Trail Run Ladies Aid, the Eastern Star of New Matamoras, the Midway Community Senior Citizens and the Antioch Homemakers Club.
In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her husband, Carl Byers, in 1968.
She leaves three daughters, Linda Eileen Colvin of New Matamoras, Judith Ann Turner of Clarington and Joyce Arlene Ludolph of Wadsworth; six grandchildren, Williard Tank, Page Thompson, Randy Turner, Cheryl O Neal, Robert Ludolph Jr., Scott Ludolph; and 9 great-grandchildren.
Friends and family may call 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Monday at the Bauer-Turner Funeral Home in Woodsfield, where services will be 11 a.m. Tuesday.
Burial will be in the Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield.
Memorial contributions may be made to St. Paul s Church of Trail Run, 43936 Joe Frobish Road, Sardis, OH 43946.
 
 
Times Recorder . . Zanesville, OH . . . 2 Apr 2002
ZANESVILLE
Jennie Louise Hook, 83, of 1136 Adair Ave., died at 6:30 p.m. Saturday, March 30, 2002, at Cedar Hill Care Center.
Born Jan. 3, 1919, in Woodsfield, she was formerly employed at Hazel-Atlas, Essex Wire and Mosaic Tile Co. and was a Protestant by faith.
Surviving are her husband, Paul Hook; a son, Harold (Carolyn) Merola Sr. of Zanesville; a daughter, Elizabeth (William) Miller of Zanesville; seven
grandchildren, Angie (Jeff) Fuller, Amy (Jamie) Krouskoupf, Jake Merola, Doreen (Ron) Wise, Tina (Tom) Campbell, Billy (Denise) Miller Jr. and Penny (Darren) Phillips; 14 great-grandchildren; and four great-great-grandchildren.
She was preceded in death by her parents, Oliver and Ethel Poulton Gatten; and four brothers, Harry, Cecil, George and Joseph Gatten.
Calling hours will be 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m. today at DeLong-Baker & Lanning Funeral Home, 56 S. Fifth St.
Services will be held at 1 p.m. Wednesday at the funeral home with Pastor Keith Lingsch officiating. Burial will be in Greenwood Cemetery.

SOURCE: Marietta Times . . Marietta, OH . . 1 Apr 2002

WOODSFIELD - Dorothy Wanita Burkhart Wilson, 74, of Ohio 145, Woodsfield, died Sunday (March 31, 2002) at the Barnesville Hospital.
She was born Jan. 3, 1928, in Woodsfield to Edward K. and Emma L. Brown Burkhart. She was a waitress and a homemaker.
She was preceded in death by her first husband, Everett Richard Burkhart Sr.; her second husband, Bruce O. Wilson; one brother, Edward D. Burkhart; and one sister, Emma Mae Burkhart.

Briggs, Frederick L. XXXXX
SOURCE: Marietta Times . . . Marietta OH . . . Apr 2002
Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
WOODSFIELD - Frederick L. Briggs, 84, of Maple Avenue died Wednesday (April 3, 2002) at Wheeling Hospital.
He was born Sept. 4, 1917, in Monroe County to Lee and Minnie Sulsberger Briggs. He was retired from the Ohio Department of Transportation, Monroe County Division.
He was a veteran of World War II. He was a member of St. Paul's United Church of Christ in Woodsfield; a charter member of Veterans of Foreign Wars Post 5303, Woodsfield; and a former member of the Woodsfield Fire Department, Monroe County Democratic Executive Committee, Monroe County Weights & Measures, and Monroe County Sportsman's Club.
He is survived by his wife, Mary E. "Babe" Tracy Briggs; one daughter, Cheryl Piatt and her husband, Dennis, of Woodsfield; two grandchildren, Jason and Staci Piatt; seven nieces; and two nephews.
He was preceded in death by his parents; and one sister and brother-in-law, Lena and Raymond Hudson.
Services are at 11 a.m. Saturday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home at 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield. Burial is in Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield with full military graveside service to be conducted by the Belmont Veterans Council. Friends will be received from 2 to 9 p.m. Friday at the funeral home.
Memorial contributions may be made to the American Cancer Society, 112 E. Court St., Woodsfield, Ohio 43793; or to St. Paul's Memorial Fund, 303 S. Main St., Woodsfield, Ohio 43793.

She is survived by her husband, George Kremer, whom she married on Dec. 28, 1946; two daughters, Linda Pratt of Waddy, Ky., and Patricia Kay of Middletown, Ohio; two sons, Jeffrey Kremer of Alpharetta, Ga., and G. Andrew Kremer of Miami, Fla.; one sister, Myra McGuire of Mason, Ohio; one half brother, Elwood Hossman of Newport; five grandchildren; and one great-grandson.

West, John " Bill" William
SOURCE: Times Recorder . . Zanesville, OH . . Apr 2002
Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
WESTERVILLE -- John William (Bill) West, 86, of Westerville, formerly of Belmont, died Saturday, April 6, 2002 at Alter Care Nursing Home Westerville.
He was born Sept. 21, 1915, in Malaga, the son of the late Dale and Ethel Brown West. Bill was former owner of the Belmont Slaughterhouse and later worked with the David Davies Meat Packing Co. of Columbus.
He retired from Duff's Smorgasbord, was a graduate of Belmont High School, a member of the New Concord United Methodist Church, a member of Hazen Masonic Lodge No. 251 of Bethesda and the Osiris Shrine of Wheeling, W.Va.
In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by his wife, Doris Ruth Witschy West.
Surviving are his best friend and companion dog, Sunny; one son, John W. West II and wife, Diann, of Akron; one daughter, Ann Geiger of Dublin; grandchildren, Krista and husband, Doug, Greg and wife, Alicia, Heidi and husband, Jimmy, John III and wife, Kelly; seven great-grandchildren, several nieces, nephews and cousins, one sister, Edith Huston of Shelby; and one brother, Harry Dale West of Las Vegas.
Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Tuesday at Kelly-Kemp-Braido Funeral Home, 322 N. Main St., Bethesda.
Services will be held at 11 a.m. Wednesday.
Burial will be in Belmont Cemetery. Hazen Masonic Lodge will have services at 7 p.m. Tuesday at the funeral home.

2002
Mallett, Argel
SOURCE: Marietta Times . . . Marietta, OH . . . 13 Apr 2002
Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
Argel Mallett, 91, of Cornerstone Drive, Marietta, and a former resident of Lower Salem, died at 10:10 a.m. Friday (April 12, 2002) at Marietta Memorial Hospital.
He was born Nov. 25, 1910, near Stafford to Wales W. and Cora Crum Mallett. He attended school at Stafford and graduated from Elk Rural High School at Hariettsville. He had worked at Wheeling Steel at Steubenville and was a dairy farmer. He had been president of Marietta Milk Producers Co-Op, was a member of Great Lakes Milk Board, Central Ohio Milk Producers, Southeastern Milk Producers Co-Op, National Federation of Milk Producers, Washington County Health Department, Washington County Soil Conservation Service board, Salem-Liberty School board member, and attended the O'Neill Senior Citizens Center. He attended Faith Bible Church. He taught Sunday school for 50 years and was an avid Bible student and scholar.
On May 13, 1933, he married Esther L. Stephens who survives with one daughter, Betty A. Haas of Marietta; one grandchild, Lee Haas; and six great-grandchildren. Also surviving are three brothers, Riley Mallett of Dunedin, Fla., Hubert Mallett of Mingo Junction and Ivan Mallett of Vero Beach, Fla.; and two sisters, Gladys Bergman of Columbus and Violet Pierce of Steubenville.
He was preceded in death by his parents; one son, James Richard Mallett; one brother, Clayton Mallett; one sister, Bernice Nichols Gilreath; and one grandson, Rex Haas.
Services are at 10:30 a.m. Monday at McClure-Schafer-Lankford Funeral Home in Marietta with Pastor Raymond Witmer III officiating. Burial is in Salem Township Cemetery. Friends may call from 2 p.m. Sunday at the funeral home. The family will greet friends from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Sunday at the funeral home.

Hupp, Vonnie Eleanor (Forshey)
SOURCE: Marietta Times . . . Marietta, OH . . . 15 Apr 2002
Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
MACKSBURG - Vonnie Eleanor Hupp, 86, of Macksburg died Sunday morning (April 14, 2002) at Selby General Hospital in Marietta.
She was born Dec. 4, 1915, in Archers Fork, Monroe County, to Jesse Adam and Hazel Mae Tice Forshey. She was a homemaker who loved sewing, reading and flower gardening. She was a Protestant by faith.
She is survived by two sons, Floyd E. (Charlene) Thompson of Caldwell and Raymond (Carol) Hupp of Macksburg; eight grandchildren; 20 great-grandchildren; one great-great-grandchild; and numerous nieces and nephews.
She was preceded in death by her husband, James Leroy Hupp, on May 27, 1983; her parents; one brother, Foster Forshey; and two sisters, Mildred VanFossen and Maxine "Dot" Moore.
Services are at 11 a.m. Tuesday at McVay-Perkins Funeral Home in Caldwell with the Rev. William Pickenpaugh officiating. Burial is in Stafford Cemetery. Friends may call from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. today at the funeral home

SUMMERFIELD - Otis P. Gray, 64, of 28030 Township Road 198, Summerfield, died at 6:10 p.m. Sunday (April 14, 2002) at the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center in Woodsfield.

Elsie M. Jones
WOODSFIELD - Elsie M. Jones, 74, of Bondi Ridge Road died Saturday (April 13, 2002) at Ohio Valley Medical Center in Wheeling, W.Va.
She was born June 25, 1927, in Monroe County to Samson and Elizabeth Conner Henthorn. She was a member of Laings Church of Christ.
She is survived by her husband, Charles A. Jones; one daughter, Dorothy Wilson and her husband, Harry, of Woodsfield; one brother, Lloyd Henthorn of Sardis; and four grandchildren, Thomas, James, Ralph and Traci Wilson.

2002X
Delmer L. Christman
Source:  Monroe County Beacon dated April 18, 2002:
          Delmer L. Christman, 82, 1275 Marion Melmore Rd., Bucyrus, died April 13, 2002, in Hartland, of Bucyrus.  He was born May 23, 1919, in Monroe County, a son of the late Lewis E. Christman and Anna K. Claus Christman.
          He farmed until 1970 and then worked for the County Highway Department retiring in1989.  He moved to this area in 1948.
          He was a member of the St. John United Church of Christ, former Lykens School Board member, North Robinson Equity board, the Crawford County Fair board member; served on the church board and was a 4-H advisor.  He enjoyed carpentry and especially liked making grandfather clocks and working in his yard.
          Surviving are his wife, Mary Grace Smith Christman, whom he married July 3, 1943; three daughters, Mrs. Leonard (Mary Jane) Bays, of Sycamore, Mrs. Richard (Dorothy) Gearhart, rural Bucyrus, Annabelle Horning, Mansfield; three granddaughters, Malynne Keiter and Tony Barker, Mrs. Todd (Betty Jo) Billings, Jody Horning; step-grandchild; great-grandson, Harley Barker; two step-great grandchildren; four brothers, Thurman Christman, Woodsfield, Robert Christman, Bucyrus, Wilbur Christman, Caledona, Edward Christman, Bolivar; brother-in-law, Charence Smith, Monroe County.
          In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by a grandson, Douglas Keiter; two brothers, Lawrence and Earnest Christman; two sisters, Celesta Welty and Louse Bower.
          Friends will be received April 17 from 11 a.m. until time of service at 1 p.m. , at Munz-Pirnstill Funeral Home, Bucyrus, with Rev. John Miller and Rev. Karla Frost officiating.  Burial will be in Oakwood Cemetery.
          Memorial contributions may be made to the American Heart Association, American Cancer Society or the Relay for Life through the funeral home.

She was born June 25,1927, in Monroe County, daughter of the late Samson and Elizabeth(Conner) Henthorn.  Mrs. Jones was a member of the Laings Church of Christ.

Allen, Mildred M. (Byers)
SOURCE: Marietta Times . . Marietta, OH . . 15 Apr 2002
Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
SARDIS - Mildred M. Allen, 86, of Seventh Avenue died Friday (April 12, 2002) at Wetzel County Hospital in New Martinsville, W.Va.
She was born Feb. 18, 1916, in Monroe County to George E. and Mary Kathryn Merckle Byers. She was a retired cook after 30 years with the Switzerland of Ohio School District and a retired custodian after 10 years with Citizens National Bank in Sardis.
She was a member of the Community Club in Sardis and the Lutheran church in Trail Run.
She was preceded in death by her husband, Raymond Allen; her parents; four brothers; and three sisters.
She is survived by one son, Galen (Teresa) Allen of Sardis; one daughter, Carolyn (William) Gano of Sardis; three brothers, George Byers of Littleton, Colo., David Byers of Macon, Ga., and Paul Byers of Woodsfield; one sister, Phyllis Mae Yost of Palm Desert, Calif.; and one grandson, William Gano of Pittsburgh, Pa.

Kenneth L. Goodhart
QUAKER CITY - Kenneth L. Goodhart, 61, of 52801 Calais Road died at 10:50 a.m. Sunday (April 28, 2002) at Barnesville Health Care Center in Barnesville.
He was born Oct. 17, 1940, near Calais to Bay and Eva Roe Goodhart. He was a former truck driver for the former Broughton's Dairy in Quaker City. He was a Protestant by faith and a U.S. Army veteran.
He is survived by three sons, Jim Goodhart and his wife, Teresa, and Jody Goodhart and his wife, Colleen, all of Newark, and Steve Goodhart and his wife, Shauna, of Circleville; one sister, Kay Flynn and her husband, Bill, of Calais; two brothers, Sam Goodhart of North Robinson, Ohio, and Ronald Goodhart and his wife, Sandy, of Warsaw, Mo.; and three grandchildren, Courtney, Chase and Benjamin Goodhart.

Calvin M. Ishii
WOODSFIELD - Calvin M. Ishii, 58, of 406 Mill St. died Monday (April 29, 2002) at Washington Hospital in Washington, Pa.
He was born April 3, 1944, in Honolulu, Hawaii, to Thomas and Evelyn Ishimoro Ishii. He was a former fleet manager for heavy-duty trucks in Sacramento, Calif. He was a U.S. Army veteran of the Vietnam era.
He is survived by his wife, Ann Hulsebus Ishii at home; one son, Donald R. Petty Jr. of Woodsfield; one daughter, Nancy Zavoda of Sacramento; and five grandchildren.

2002
Bott, Hugh L.
SOURCE: Marietta Times . . . Marietta, OH . . . Apr 2002
Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
WOODSFIELD - Dr. Hugh L. Bott, 89, of 135 North Main St. died at 1:20 p.m. Thursday (April 25, 2002) at the Monroe County Care Center in Woodsfield.
He was born Dec. 20, 1912, at the family farm east of Woodsfield to Charles F. and Georgia Neuhart Bott. He was a 1931 graduate of Woodsfield High School in Woodsfield and a 1938 graduate of The Ohio State University with a degree in optometry. He practiced optometry in Woodsfield from 1938 to 1974. He was a member of St. Sylvester Catholic Church in Woodsfield. He was the oldest member of the Monroe County Ohio State University Alumni Association, a life member of the Monroe County Historical Society, a life member of the Ohio Optometric Association, and the American Optometric Association.
He is survived by one daughter, Helen Marie McGinnis and her husband, John, of Laurens, S.C.; and six nieces, Karen Bott, Joann Brannon, Becky Bott, Monica Long, Lynn Rohr and Samantha Moore.
He was preceded in death by his wife, Marie K. Brooks Bott, on Jan. 31, 1998; his parents; one brother, Charles D. Bott, on Dec. 27, 2001; and a nephew, Daniel Bott, on April 25, 1994.
Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 6 to 9 p.m. Sunday at Watters Funeral Home, 37501 Ohio 78 West, Woodsfield.
Mass of Christian burial will be celebrated at 11 a.m. Monday at St. Sylvester Catholic Church in Woodsfield with the Rev. David Gaydosik as celebrant. Burial will follow in the church cemetery. Vigil services are at 8 p.m. Sunday at the funeral home.
Memorial contributions may be made to St. Sylvester Catholic School, 119 Wayne St., Woodsfield, Ohio 43793; or the Woodsfield High School Alumni Scholarship Fund in care of Carol Schumacher, 139 Maple Ave., Woodsfield, Ohio 43793.
 
2002
Wilson, Mabel Dorothy (Deist)
SOURCE: Marietta Times . . . Marietta, OH . . 30 Apr 02
Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
LOWELL - Mabel Dorothy Wilson, 94, of Third Street died at 7 a.m. Monday (April 29, 2002) at the Marietta Nursing and Rehabilitation Center.
She was born Sept. 18, 1907, in Trail Run, Monroe County, to George and Mary Deist. She had lived in the Lowell area most of her life. She had taught for 25 years in the Newport and Waterford schools. She was a member of St. John's Evangelical Church and had served on the church council. She was a graduate of Ohio University. She was a 50-year member of Order of Eastern Star 272 at Lowell and Washington County Retired Teachers Association.
She is survived by one son, George A. Wilson and his wife, Louella, of Lowell; one granddaughter, Melissa Cogswell and her husband, Ben, of Lowell; and two great-grandsons, Harry Wilson "Will" Cogswell and Max Chancellor Cogswell.
On Aug. 20, 1931, she married Covert O. "Tobe" Wilson. He died in May 1955. She was also preceded in death by two sisters, Rose West and Hilda Long; and one brother, Alfred Deist.
Services are at 11 a.m. Thursday at St. John's Evangelical Church with Pastors James Fernihough and Gale Lauderman officiating. Burial is in Greenlawn Cemetery. Friends may call from 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m. Wednesday at the Lowell Chapel of Cawley & Peoples Funeral Home and for one hour prior to the service Thursday at the church.
Memorial contributions may be made to St. John's Church, P.O. Box 303, Lowell, Ohio 45744; or the L-A Fire and Rescue Squad, P.O. Box 406, Lowell, Ohio 45744.

Carpenter, Virgil
SOURCE: Times Recorder . . . Zanesville, OH . . 1 May 2002
Provi ded by Betty Lendon Matson
BARNESVILLE -- Virgil Carpenter, 74, of Malta, died Monday, April 29, 2002, at Genesis Hospice, Morrison House.
He was born March 1, 1928, in Monroe County, son of the late Nelson and Zelma Carpenter.
Surviving are his wife, Mary Ellen (Tracy) Carpenter; a son, Nelson Howard Carpenter of New Matamoras; five daughters, Patsy (James) Carpenter of Barnesville, Joyce Woodward of Malta, Sharon (Don) Johnson of Michigan, Rose Moore of Steubenville and Betty (Richard) Landers of Polock, Texas; four brothers, Lloyd Carpenter of West Salem, Kenny Carpenter of Ashland, Norman Carpenter of Jensen Beach, Fla., and Gordon Carpenter of Barnesville; three step siblings; 12 grandchildren; and three great-grandchildren.
He was preceded in death by a daughter, Barbara; and three brothers, Bill, John and Leonard Carpenter.
Calling hours will be 7 to 9 p.m. Thursday at Campbell-Plumly-Milburn Funeral Home, 319 N. Chestnut St., Barnesville, where services will be held at 1 p.m. Burial will be in Crestview Cemetery, Barnesville.
 
 
Marietta Times, May 1, 2002
David Todd
WOODSFIELD - David Todd, 91, of Ohio 255, Woodsfield, died Monday (April 29, 2002) at the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center.
He was born June 23, 1910, in Belmont County to George and Dale Shreve Todd. He was a retired employee of the former Martins Ferry Hospital and had also worked for Y&O Coal Co. He attended Moffett Methodist Church near Woodsfield.
He is survived by his wife, Catherine Veres Todd of Woodsfield; one son, David Todd Jr. and his wife, Sis, of Woodsfield; one daughter, Virginia Pitcher and her husband, John, of Woodsfield; three grandchildren, Dave Pitcher, Dan Pitcher and David Todd III; and three great-grandchildren.
He was preceded in death by his parents and one brother, Benjamin Ellis Todd.
Services are at 11 a.m. Thursday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, with the Rev. James Porter officiating. Burial is in Union Cemetery in St. Clairsville. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. today at the funeral home.

2002
Marietta times, Sat. May 4, 2002
Robert Ray Farnsworth
WOODSFIELD - Robert Ray Farnsworth, 98, of the Monroe County Care Center died at 5:15 p.m. Thursday (May 2, 2002) at the center.
He was born June 12, 1903, in Stafford to William Farnsworth and Jane Light Farnsworth Neibach. He was a retired welder and a member of Woodsfield Church of Christ in Woodsfield.
He is survived by two nieces and one nephew.
Friends will be received from 4 to 6 p.m. Sunday at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield. Burial will be Monday at the convenience of the family in Sutherland Cemetery near Lewisville.

2002
Marietta Times, May 10, 2002
Virginia M. Hogue, 89
WOODSFIELD -- Virginia M. Hogue, 89, of Whipple, formerly of Pleasant Ridge, Graysville, died May 8, 2002, at Riverside Hospital, Columbus.
She was born Sept. 19, 1912, at New Martinsville, W.Va., a daughter of the late L. E. Smith and Ella Rist Smith.
She was a member of the Hartshorn Ridge Church of Christ.
She was preceded in death by her husband, Roy Hogue; one daughter, Ruth Ella Baker; and one brother, Charles Smith.
She is survived by one son, Coy Hogue and his wife, Cynthia, of Bellingham, Wash.; one brother, Al Smith and his wife, Barbara, of Columbus; and two sisters, Helen Crain and her husband, Frank, of St. Louis, Mo., and Jacqueline Arango of Washington, D.C.; six grandchildren, Debbie Hedger and her husband, Bud, of Sarasota, Fla., Sharon Huffman and her husband, John, of Jerusalem, Russell Headley of Woodsfield, Jeanie Carpenter and her husband, Steve, of Whipple, Carmen Roberge and her husband, Carl, of South Surrey, British Columbia, Canada, and Shirley Thompson of Marietta; 14 great-grandchildren and 10 great-great-grandchildren; an aunt, Ada Parks of Marietta; and several nieces and nephews.
Friends will be received from 7 to 9 p.m. Saturday and 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Sunday at the Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, where services will be held at 11 a.m. Monday with Gary Hogue officiating. Interment will be in the Hartshorn Ridge Church of Christ Cemetery near Graysville.
Memorial contributions may be made to the Hartshorn Ridge Church of Christ, c/o Gary Hogue, 43670 Ullman-Hines Road, Lewisville, Ohio 43754.
Originally published Friday, May 10, 2002
