2002
Lisk, John C.
SOURCE: Marietta Times . . . Marietta, OH . . . May 2002
Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
RINARD MILLS - John C. Lisk, 85, of 35200 Witten Creek Road died at 10:55 a.m. Saturday (May 11, 2002) at Marietta Memorial Hospital.
He was born June 1, 1916, near Rinard Mills to Samuel and Ella Black Lisk. He was a former employee of River Gas Co. and was a former superintendent of the former Monroe County Home in Woodsfield. He was a Protestant by faith and was a U.S. Army veteran of World War II.
He was preceded in death by his wife, Marjorie Beryl Scott Lisk, on April 21, 2000; his parents; one sister, Dorothy Weddle; and one brother, Lester Lisk.
He is survived by two daughters, Angela Jo Armstrong and Denise Lynn Williams and her husband, Jamie, both of Rinard Mills; three brothers, Arthur Lisk, Virgil Lisk and Junior Lisk, all of Marietta; one grandson, John Fortney; and several nieces and nephews.
Services are at 1 p.m. Wednesday at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield with Tim Fleeman officiating. Burial is in Oaklawn Cemetery with full military graveside services to be conducted by the Belmont Veterans Council. Friends will be received from 7 to 9 p.m. Tuesday at the funeral home.
 
 
 
Marietta Times, Thursday, May 16, 2002
John F. Schmidt
WOODSFIELD - John F. Schmidt, 61, of 237 S. Main St. died Tuesday evening (May 14, 2002) at Mercy Hospital in Pittsburgh, Pa.
He was born Feb. 10, 1941, in Chicago, Ill., to John and Freida Bavaronschutz Schmidt Jr. He graduated from the Chicago Conservatory of Music in Chicago. He was an attendant at the BP gas station in Woodsfield. He was a member of Praise Pentecostal Fellowship Church at Woodsfield. He was a U.S. Army veteran of the Vietnam era.
He is survived by his wife, Nancy Zeh Schmidt, whom he married Oct. 16, 1976; two daughters, Mindy Zeh of Beallsville and Naomi Schmidt at home; two sons, John F. Schmidt Jr. at home and Philip Andrew Schmidt and his fianceˇ, Melinda Ferguson, at home; his mother of Lakeview, Ark.; one sister, Julie Sweat of Mount Prospect, Ill.; one brother, Joseph Schmidt of Lakeview; and one nephew.
He was preceded in death by his father.
Services are at 1 p.m. Saturday at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield with Pastor Paul Ferguson officiating. Burial is in Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield. Friends will be received from 7 to 9 p.m. Friday at the funeral home.
 
Marietta Times, Wednesday, May 15, 2002
Beulah M. Heft
COLUMBUS - Beulah M. Heft, 90, of Columbus, formerly of Lewisville, died Monday (May 13, 2002) at Riverside Hospital in Columbus.
She was born May 4, 1912, in Monroe County to John and Leona Hoffmeister Heft. She was a 1931 graduate of Lewisville High School. A 22-year employee of Herr Printing Co. of Columbus, she later retired from the Ohio Department of Health in Columbus. She was a member of St. John's Evangelical Protestant Church of Columbus.
She is survived by one brother, Floyd Heft and his wife, Elaine, of St. Petersburg, Fla.; one sister, Wilda Bartenschlag of Lewisville; and several nieces and nephews.
She was preceded in death by her parents; two brothers, Rolland and Urban Heft; and one sister, Mildred Hulme.
Services are at 1 p.m. Friday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, with the Rev. William L. Worcester officiating. Burial is in Friendship Cemetery in Lewisville. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Thursday at the funeral home.
Memorial contributions may be made to Community Resources, 14 W. Lakeview Ave., Columbus, Ohio 43202; or St. John's Evangelical Protestant Church, 59 E. Mound St., Columbus, Ohio 43110.

May 15, 2002, Barnesville Enterprise
McConaughy, Dorothy W., nee Keiser : Dorothy W. McConaughy, 88, of Barnesville, died Sunday May 12, 2002 at her home. She was born Feb 16, 1914, in Tuscarawas County, daughter of the lat Walter Scott and Myrtle Iona Stephan Keiser. She was preceded in death by her husband, Carl McConaughy; and infant son; three brothers and four sisters. She leaves two sons, Walter McConaughy of New Brighton, PA., and Ralph McConaughy of Jackson, TN.; three daughters, Luella Kidd, Mrs. Hubert (Shirley) Chappell and Mrs. Charles (Priscilla) Warrick, all of Barnesville; tow sisters, Mildred Grandi of Jerusalem and Geraldine Miller of Barnesville; several grandchildren and great-great- grandchildren. Friends were received Tuesday at Campbell-Plumly-Milburn Funeral Home, Barnesville, where services will be at 11 a.m. Wednesday with Pastor Rodney West officiating. Burial will be in Ebenezer Cemetery, Bethesda.

Marietta Times, May 24, 2002
Celeste Bonnie Young, nee Curtis
COLUMBUS - Celeste Bonnie Young, 95, of Columbus, formerly of Woodsfield, died Wednesday (May 22, 2002) at Mount Carmel West in Columbus.
She was born Sept. 1, 1906, in Harrisville to Henry Singer and Flossie Curtis.
She is survived by one daughter, Marie Riley of Mason, Ohio; two sons, John H. (Sue) Young and Ronnie V. (Brenda) Young, all of Columbus; five grandchildren; two sisters, Estella Tyson and Esther Jackson; and two brothers, Cale and Oscar Lee Singer.
She was preceded in death by her husband, Earl Young.
Services are at 11 a.m. Tuesday at Schoedinger Cleveland Avenue Chapel, 2741 Cleveland Ave., Columbus. Graveside services are at 3 p.m. Tuesday in Stafford Cemetery in Stafford, Ohio. Friends may call from 10 to 11 a.m. Tuesday at the chapel.

2002
Marietta Times, Marietta, Ohio
Monday, May 27, 2002
Genevie Vickers, nee Sims
Genevie Vickers, 80, of Michigan Avenue, Marietta, died Saturday afternoon
(May 25, 2002) at Selby General Hospital.
She was born Dec. 22, 1921, in Parkersburg to William Clarence and Lillie May Athey Sims.
She is survived by one daughter, Diane Fleming and her husband, Phillip, of Devola, with whom she had made her home for the last three years; two
grandsons, Robert Douglas Hendershot and his wife, Kim, of Cambridge and
James R. Vickers Jr. and his wife, Lori, of Stockport; two granddaughters, Wanda Hannel of Columbus and Kristy King and her husband, Jimmy, of Marengo, Ohio; seven great-grandchildren; one brother, Fred Sims and his wife, Marguerite, of Fleming; three sisters, Nellie Davis and her husband,
Larry, of Poland, Ohio, Lillie May Lent and her husband, Robert, of Lowell
and Dorothy Schneider and her husband, Fred, of Tuscaloosa, Ala.; and
numerous nieces and nephews.
On Aug. 27, 1938, she married Cecil I. Vickers. He died Dec. 10,
1990. She was also preceded in death by one son, James R. Vickers, on Aug.
16, 1992; her parents; one granddaughter, Brenda Vickers; and one sister, Irene Armstrong.
Services are at 1 p.m. Tuesday at McClure-Schafer-Lankford Funeral Home in Marietta with Roger Rush officiating. Burial is in Putnam Cemetery. Friends may call from noon today until the hour of the service at the funeral home. The family will be present to meet friends from 7 to 9 p.m. today at the funeral home.
Memorial contributions may be made to the Devola Fire Department, Masonic
Park Road, Marietta, Ohio 45750.

2002
Ring, Harold E.
SOURCE: Marietta Times . . . Marietta, OH . . . 27 May 02
Harold E. Ring, 84, of Holly Street, Marietta, died Thursday (May 23, 2002) at his home.
He was born Oct. 22, 1917, in Rinard Mills, Monroe County, to Charles Everett and Mary Ida Piatt Ring. He was a service station owner in Marietta. He was an Army Air Force veteran of World War II, tail gunner (1943-1945), with the 96th bomb group, 8th Air Force 337 squadron. He was a member of American Legion and Veterans of Foreign Wars at Marietta.
He is survived by two daughters, Judith Finn of Novato, Calif., and Beverly Panelli of San Rafael, Calif.; two sisters, Marjorie Lindamood of Ohio and Ruth Thomas of Ohio; two grandchildren, Kelly Margaret Finn and Sean Richard Finn; and several nieces and nephews.
He was preceded in death by his wife, Edith Briggs Ring; his parents; and two sisters.
Services are at 1 p.m. Tuesday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield. Burial is in Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield with full military graveside services. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. today at the funeral home.

2002
Traxler, Delilah Joan Flowers
SOURCE:The State, Columbia, SC, Sunday, June 4, 2000
ST. GEORGE, SC---Funeral services for Delilah Joan Flowers Traxler, 78, will be held at 11 a.m. Tuesday in Grover United Methodist Church with burial to follow in the Westbury Cemetery directed by Bryant Funeral Home. Visitation will be 6-8 p.m. Monday at Bryant Funeral Home, St. George.
Mrs. Traxler, formerly of MT. PLEASANT, SC, died Saturday, June 3, 2000 in the Colleton Medical Center, Walterboro, SC, after an extended illness. She was born January 14, 1922 in MECHANICSBURG, OH, the daughter of the late Garland & Goldie Martin Flowers. She was the widow of Laurence Roland Traxler, was a member of Grover United Methodist Church, life member of the Ladies Auxiliary Post 10624 V.F.W., she was a member & past worthy matron of Alhambra Chapter # 60 O.E.S., Yorktown CV-10 Association, life member of Disabled American Veterans Auxiliary, & Women's Auxiliary to the MOC.
Surviving are a number of nieces & nephews.

Zanesville Times Recorder, Friday, June 7, 2002
BARNESVILLE -- Robert Wesley Haring, Sr., 65, of Summerfield, died Monday, June 3, 2002, at Barnesville Memorial Hospital.
Surviving are one daughter, Ann McCormick of Summerfield; two sons, John and Robert W. Haring, Jr. of Georgia; one brother, Donald F. Haring, Sr. of Summerfield; six grandchildren; and five great-grandchildren.
No visitation or public service will be observed. McVay-Perkins Funeral Home in Caldwell has charge of arrangements.

Marietta Times, Friday, June 14, 2002
Gerald A. 'Jerry' Scott
LEWISVILLE - Gerald A. "Jerry" Scott, 56, of 35467 Ohio 78, Lewisville, died at 2:37 a.m. Thursday (June 13, 2002) at Marietta Memorial Hospital in Marietta.
He was born Nov. 26, 1945, in Lewisville to Harmon and Thelma Kuhn Scott. He was a 1963 graduate of the former Skyvue High School in Stafford. He was an employee of Ormet Corp. in Hannibal.
He was a member of St. Joseph Catholic Church near Lewisville and Steelworkers of America Union 5760. He served in the Army National Guard of Ohio and was a former Little League coach at Lewisville.
He is survived by his wife, Sharon Hines Scott, whom he married on July 29, 1972; two daughters, Michele Stiltner of Gibsonton, Fla., and Stacy Reed and her husband, Greg, of Columbus; two sons, Michael Scott of Cambridge and David Scott of Athens; four sisters, Charlene Lenser of Rocky River, Ohio, Janet Johnson and Debbie Scott, both of Croton, Ohio, and Nancy Scott of Columbus; five brothers, Franklin Scott of Westerville, Richard Scott of Columbus, and Gene Scott, Jim Scott and Philip Scott, all of Lewisville; three grandchildren, R.J. and Meghan Stiltner and Karenna Reed; and several nieces and nephews.
He was preceded in death by his parents; one brother, Michael Scott; and one sister, Bonnie Scott.
Mass of Christian burial will be celebrated at 10 a.m. Saturday at St. Joseph Catholic Church near Lewisville with the Rev. David Gaydosik as celebrant. Burial will be in Chapel Hill Cemetery near Lewisville. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 6 to 9 p.m. today at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield, where vigil services will be conducted at 8 p.m. today.
 
======================
Marietta Times, Monday, June 17, 2002
Monday, June 17, 2002
Donald Eugene Collmar
WOODSFIELD - Donald Eugene Collmar, 77, of the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center in Woodsfield died at 5:10 a.m. Sunday (June 16, 2002) at the center.
He was born Jan. 4, 1925, in Moundsville, W.Va., to William and Icy Pearl McMillan Collmar. He was a former employee of the Ormet Corp. in Hannibal. He was a Methodist by faith.
A U.S. Army veteran, he served during World War II. He was also a U.S. Air Force veteran, serving during the Korean conflict. He was a member of Veterans of Foreign Wars Post 5303 in Woodsfield, Fraternal Order of Eagles and the American Legion at Beallsville.
He was preceded in death by his parents; two brothers, William Collmar and Raymond Collmar; three sisters, Mary Eikleberry, Edna Bishop and Hazel Dobbs; and one grandson, Mark Collmar.
He is survived by four daughters, Carolyn Ludwig of Woodsfield, Carole Hutton of Bannock, Ohio, Denise Redpath of Bellaire, and Donna Baker of Woodsfield; two sons, Rex Collmar of Woodsfield and Jeff Collmar of Madisonville, Ky.; one brother, Kenneth Collmar of Springfield; 16 grandchildren; and several great-grandchildren.
Services are at 1 p.m. Tuesday at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield with Keith Jones officiating. Burial will be at the convenience of the family in Yorkville, Ohio. Friends will be received from 11 a.m. Tuesday until time for the services at the funeral home.

Marietta Times, June 17, 2002
Grethel L. Winland, nee Smith
WOODSFIELD - Grethel L. Winland, 84, of 302 Monroe Manor, formerly of Graysville, died at 2:22 p.m. Sunday (June 16, 2002) at the Monroe County Care Center in Woodsfield.
She was born Oct. 27, 1917, in Knox County, Ohio, to Jim and Mary Edith Dillon Smith. She was a homemaker and a member of Graysville Church of Christ at Graysville.
She is survived by five sons, Don Winland and his wife, Brenda, and Roy Winland and his wife, Ila May, all of Ashland, and Floyd Winland and his wife, Patsy, Walter Winland and Carl Winland and his wife, all of Graysville; two daughters, Norma Jean Pentello of Reynoldsburg and Pamela Winland of Woodsfield; one brother, Lloyd Smith of Mansfield; three sisters, Maggie McLaughlin and Helen Patton, both of Mansfield, and Frances Dillon of New Philadelphia; 18 grandchildren; 32 great-grandchildren; and five great-great-grandchildren.
She was preceded in death by her husband, Vernon "Peanut" Winland; her parents; three brothers, Bill Smith, Bob Smith and Ralph Smith; and one granddaughter, Angela Pentello.
Services are at 2 p.m. Wednesday at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield with Roy Winland and Harold Kinney Jr. officiating. Burial is in Graysville Church of Christ Cemetery at Graysville. Friends will be received from 7 to 9 p.m. Tuesday at the funeral home.

======================
Marietta Times
William 'Bill' Merritt Davis
WOODSFIELD - William "Bill" Merritt Davis, 55, of Woodsfield died Monday, June 17, 2002, at The Ohio State University Medical Center in Columbus of complications from a motor vehicle accident which occurred Nov. 21, 2001, near Williamsburg, Ky.
He was born April 18, 1947, in Cleveland to Robert M. and Myrtle Pazourek Davis. He was a 1966 graduate of Brecksville High School and a 1986 graduate of Swiss Hills Truck Driving School. He was a volunteer firefighter in several communities, including Beallsville, Vallecito Lake, Colo., Northfield and Broadview Heights, Ohio.
He is survived by his mother of Marietta; one son, Jamie Davis of Akron; two sisters, Marilyn Gibson of Woodsfield and Columbus, and Martha Robbins and her husband, John, of Marietta; three nephews, Michael Gibson of Los Angeles, Calif., David Gibson Jr. and his wife, Leigh, of Circleville and Joshua Gibson of Woodsfield; two nieces, Melanie Robbins of Marietta and Julie Snodgrass and her husband, William, of Laurel, Md.; and a special friend, Emily McManus of Pennsylvania.
He was preceded in death by his father and three brothers, Richard, Robert and James Davis.
Memorial services are at 2 p.m. Sunday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home in Woodsfield. Friends will be received from 1 p.m. Sunday until the hour of the service at the funeral home.
Memorial contributions may be made to a local humane society.

SOURCE: Marietta Times . . . Marietta, OH . . . June 2002
WOODSFIELD - Edward P. Kaiser, 61, of Woodsfield died Wednesday (June 26, 2002) at Abingdon, Va.
He was born March 3, 1941, in Woodsfield to Charles H. and Inez F. Ayers Kaiser. He was a U.S. Navy veteran.
He is survived by three stepsons, Michael Kaiser, Dominec Kaiser and Daniel Kaiser, all of Ohio; five sisters, Dolores Jean Kaiser of Gallipolis, Angela Anderson of Fairfax, Va., Ruthella Backman of Lew Beach, N.Y., Fran Ballentine of Abingdon, Va., and Patricia Ferguson of Ellenwood, Ga.; and several nieces and nephews.
He was preceded in death by his parents.

Pachuta, Emil J.
SOURCE: Monroe County Beacon . . . . Woodsfield, OH . . 27 June 2002
Emil J. Pachuta, 74, Canton, died June 17, 2002 in the Aultman Hospital following an extended illness.
He was a retired truck driver for Jackson Bayley ELectric and a member of St. Joseph Catholic Church in Canton. He served his country during WW II in the US Army.
Surviving are his wife, Joyce, with whom he would have celebrated 49 years of marriage this November; three daughters, Mrs. Ed (Debbie) MIller, Jerusalem, Emily Stenger, Massillon, Mrs. Scott (Julie) Bates, Quaker City; son Thomas Pachuta, Canton; sister, Mrs. Joseph (Mary) Kozar, Lore CIty; brother, Andrew and his wife, Evelyn Pachuta, East Sparta; six grandchildren, Angie, Sheila and Todd Miller, Anna Pachuta, Jenna Stenger and Amanda Bates.
He was preceded in death by his parents, John and Teresa Pachuta; brother, MIchael.
Friends were received June 10 at Don Williams Funeral Home and on ehour prior to Mass of Christian Burial, June 20, in tyhe St. Mary's Church, Temperanceville, wiht Fr. VIrgil Reischman as celebrant. Brurial followed in the church cemtery with military honors.

Keevert, Dean R.
SOURCE: Marietta Times . . . Marietta, OH . . . Jul 2002
WOODSFIELD - Dean R. Keevert, 59, of Woodsfield died Sunday (July 7, 2002) at his home.
He was born March 14, 1943, in Woodsfield to Roger W. "Johnny" and Dorothy Camden Keevert. He was retired from Ormet Corp. at Hannibal. He was a member of Woodsfield Church of Christ.
He is survived by his wife, Dorothy McConnell Keevert; one son, Phillip Keevert and his wife, Christine, of Columbus; one daughter, Deana Roper and her husband, Mitch, of Sistersville, W.Va.; two brothers, James Keevert and his wife, Janet, of Hendersonville, N.C., and Gary Keevert and his wife, Janet, of Woodsfield; his father-in-law, Fred McConnell of Woodsfield; seven grandchildren; and two stepgrandchildren.
He was preceded in death by his parents.

======================
Zanesville Times, Tuesday, July 16, 2002
Della Mae Lewis Christman, 92
SOMERSET -- Della Mae Lewis Christman, 92, of Somerset, died at 4:15 a.m. Saturday, July 13, 2002, at the Somerset Healthcare Center.
Della was born March 3, 1910, in Shawnee, the daughter of the late David and Sarah Anderson Lewis.
She attended Shawnee High School, had been a member of Shawnee Methodist Church and was a volunteer at Sullivant Avenue Elementary School in Columbus through the Foster Grandparents program. While a resident of McDowell Senior center in Columbus, she was an active member of the senior drill team and tap dance group. She retired from Columbus Dental Supplies after 31 years of service.
Surviving are her daughter, Helen Shaffer of Columbus; grandchildren Clarence (Diane) Shaffer, Cindy (Chuck) Gregory, Gene Shaffer, Chris and James Berry; great-grandchildren Aaron and Emma Shaffer, Amanda, Brandon and Kara Gregory; several other great-grandchildren, a sister-in-law Evelyn Lewis, and many nieces and nephews.
She was preceded in death, in addition to her parents, by her son, James Berry; sisters Margaret McGirr, Maude Scheiderer, Ruth Hannah, Rachel Carter, Dorothy Dupler; brothers, the Rev. David Lewis and Charles D. Lewis Sr.; twin infant grandchildren; and her husband, Paul Berry.
No calling hours will be observed. A memorial service will be held at 10 a.m. Thursday, July 18, at Bope-Thomas Funeral Home in Somerset with her nephew, the Rev. Gary Miller of the Salem United Methodist Church in Alliance, officiating. Burial will be in Shawnee Cemetery.
Originally published Tuesday, July 16, 2002
======================
Robert C. Carpenter, age 71, of Mount Vernon died Sunday July 21, 2002 at Wawing Lake Resort in Ontario, Canada of an apparent heart attack. Robert was born July 9, 1931 in Malaga, Ohio to Clifford E. and Pearl (Stephen) Carpenter and had spent most of his lifetime in the Mount Vernon area. He served in the U S Army 82nd Airborne Division. Robert had been employed as a journeyman machinist for Cooper Industries in Mount Vernon, Ohio Brass Company in Mansfield, Mount Vernon Machine Tool and retired from Hydraulic Press Manufacturing in Mount Gilead. He was an avid sportsman and loved the Cleveland Indians and Cleveland Browns.
Surviving are his wife Nora (Coon) Carpenter whom he married February 19, 1954; five sons Cliff (Amy) Carpenter, David (Jeanette) Carpenter, and Chad (Sara Hess) Carpenter all of Mount Vernon, Rob (Deb) Carpenter of Howard and Josh (Staci) Carpenter of Orrville; two daughters Lynne (Russ) Edgar of Edgar Springs, Missouri and Jill Carpenter of Mount Vernon; 8 grandchildren; 3 great granddaughters; 3 brothers Elmer (Gerry) Carpenter and Neil (Barbara) Carpenter both of Mount Vernon and Irvin (Mary) Carpenter of North Liberty; and 2 sisters Evelyn McCleary and Judy Clevenger both of Mount Vernon. Besides his parents he was preceded in death by 4 sisters Viola Robinson, Mary Ann Davis, Betty Carpenter and Joan Carpenter and 4 brothers Harold Stephen, Edward Carpenter, Francis Carpenter and Virgil Carpenter.
Friends may call Thursday from 5 to 8 PM at the Flowers-Snyder Funeral Home in Mount Vernon where funeral Services will be Friday at 11 AM with Rev. Brian Durbin officiating. Burial with Military honors by the Knox County Joint Veterans Council will be in Mount Vernon Memorial Gardens.
Memorial contributions can be made to the Salvation Army, 206 East Ohio Ave. Mount Vernon, Ohio 43050 or to the charity of your choice.
This obituary and guest registry are online at www.snyderfuneralhomes.com
 
======================
2002
Lude, Wilber Henry
Source: Marietta Times, Marietta Ohio, 30 July 2002
  Moundsville, W. Va. - Wilber H. Lude, 85, of Elm Avenue died Sunday (July 28, 2002) at the Bishop Hodges Continuous Care Center in Wheeling, W. Va.
  He was born Feb. 12, 1917, in Antioch, to Clarence C.[Chris] and Clare E. [Elizabeth] Hoff Lude. He was retired from the former Allied Chemical Corp. He was a member of McMechen Church of Christ, served on the Moundsville Council and was a former mayor of Moundsville. [Note: His mother's name was Clara, not Clare]
  He is survived by his wife of 64 years, Gladys L. Jackson Lude of Moundsville; two sons, Don Lude and his wife, Suzy, of Indiana and Roger Lude and his wife, Shirley, of Syracuse, Ohio; four daughters, Garnet Blake and her husband, Lonnie, of New Martinsville, W. Va., Connie Martin and her husband,Charles, of Moundsville, Cathy Ramsey and her husband, Martin, of Powhatan Point and Sandra Ferrie and her husband, Albert, of Cleveland; two sisters, Florence Lallathin and her husband, Ralph, of Antioch and N. Ruth Sampson of Bethleham, W. Va.; one brother, Clarence P. Lude of Woodsfield; 21 grandchildren; 26 great-grandchildren, and several nieces and nephews.
  Services are at 2 p.m. Thursday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, with Evangelist Bill Carroll officiating. Burial is in West Union Cemetery near Sardis. Friends will be received from 2 to 9 p.m. Wednesday at the funeral home.
  Memorial contributions may be made to West Union Cemetery, in care of Bob Kinney, 43074 Monroe County 10A., Woodsfield, Ohio 43793.

======================
Marietta times, Friday, August 16, 2002
Walter C. Rothenbuhler
WORTHINGTON - Walter C. Rothenbuhler, 82, of Worthington died Wednesday (Aug. 14, 2002) after a long battle with Parkinson's Disease.
He was born May 4, 1920, in Monroe County to Samuel and Ferne Rothenbuhler. He graduated from high school in Woodsfield, and began college at The Ohio State University. He served in the U.S. Army Medical Department from 1942 to 1946.
He married Claribel Hall of Ashtabula County in 1944. He finished his education at Iowa State University. Four children were born in Ames, Iowa, where the family lived until 1962. After earning Bachelor of Science degree, a master's degree and a doctorate degree at Iowa State, he began his career there as an assistant professor in 1954, as an expert in honey bee research. He was recruited by Ohio State and moved his research operations there in 1962. The family home was in Worthington. He was internationally known for honey bee genetics, including breeding for disease resistance and pioneering research on behavior genetics. He was also an award-winning teacher and was proud of the courses he designed and taught in animal behavior and honey bee biology. He retired from Ohio State in 1985. The Rothenbuhler Honey Bee Research Laboratory there was named in his honor in 1989. He trained 44 graduate students and published about 75 papers; he was an AAAS Fellow, an active member of many professional societies, including American Men and Women Science, and served on the National Research Council Committee on the African Bee, 1971-72.
He was also active at First Christian Church in Ames, Iowa, and after 1962, in the Northwest Christian Church, Upper Arlington. He held positions of deacon, elder, Sunday school superintendent, and education committee member and chair. He was an early advocate of adult church education, participating in group-process-based classes in the 1950s and leading them in the 1960s.
He is survived by his wife of 58 years, Claire Rothenbuhler; four children, Leonard and Roberta Rothenbuhler of Indianapolis, Ind., Lorraine and Don Holycross of Blowing Rock, N.C., Eric Rothenbuhler and Jane Martin of Jersey City, N.J., and Hilda and Allan Talib of Dayton; six grandchildren; three sisters; and many nieces and nephews.
He was preceded in death by his parents; two brothers; and an infant sister.
Services are at 10:30 a.m. Saturday at Northwest Christian Church, 1340 Fishinger Road, Columbus, where friends may call for one hour prior to the service. The Rev. Cynthia Adcock will be officiating. Rutherford-Corbin Funeral Home, Worthington Chapel, 515 High St., Worthington, is in charge of arrangements.
Additional visitation hours will be held at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, from noon to 2 p.m. Monday, when funeral services will be at 2 p.m. Burial is in Cameron Community Center, Cameron, Ohio.
Memorial contributions may be made to the Rothenbuhler Parkinson's Research Fund, c/o OSU Medical Center Development, 1375 Perry St., Room 509B, Columbus, Ohio 43201; the Walter C. Rothenbuhler Travel Scholarship Fund, College of Biological Sciences, Ohio State University, 484 W. 12th Ave., Columbus, Ohio 43210; or to Northwest Christian Church, 1340 Fishinger Road, Columbus, Ohio 43221.
======================
Marietta Times, Monday, August 19, 2002
Mildred Warfield Miracle
WOODSFIELD - Mildred Warfield Miracle, 97, of the Monroe County Care Center in Woodsfield, formerly of Stafford, died at 7:55 p.m. Saturday (Aug. 17, 2002) at the center.
She was born Jan. 17, 1905, near Summerfield to Richard Orville and Margaret Wastella VanFossen Warfield. She graduated from Lowell Normal School and attended Muskingum College in New Concord and Ohio University in Athens.
She was a retired school teacher, having taught in various schools throughout the area. She was a member of Stafford United Methodist Church in Stafford, Graysville Grange, Ohio Retired Teachers Association and the Monroe County Retired Teachers Association.
She is survived by one son, Donald R. Miracle and his wife, Rebecca, of Clarington; two daughters, Evelyn Weber and her husband, Thurman, of Woodsfield and Virgene Mulford and her husband, Bush, of Naples, Fla.; nine grandchildren; 15 great-grandchildren; three step grandchildren; and two step great-grandchildren.
On Nov. 29, 1924, she married Roy D. Miracle. He died May 18, 1994. She was also preceded in death by one sister, Bernice Odessa Miracle; and one brother, George Earl Warfield.
Services are at 1 p.m. Wednesday at Stafford United Methodist Church with the Rev. Richard Wilson officiating. Burial is in Sutherland Cemetery near Stafford.
Friends will be received from 7 to 9 p.m. today and 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Tuesday at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield. Friends will then be received from noon until the time of service at the church.

Marietta Times, Wednesday, August 21, 2002
Robert Franklin Farnsworth
QUAKER CITY - Robert Franklin Farnsworth, 67, of 52801 Cleveland Hollow Road, died Saturday (Aug. 17, 2002) at his home.
He was born Sept. 18, 1935, near Calais, Ohio, to Hobort F. and Florence Stephens Farnsworth. He was a retired laborer in the sawmill business.
He is survived by four daughters, Brenda Cooper of Stanton, Ky., Terri Workman of Coshocton, and Bobbi Jo and Deanne, both of Texas; four sisters, Vera Curlutor and Mary Nalley, both of Summerfield, and Evelyn Stimpert and Elizabeth "Peggy" Pittman, both of Malaga; four brothers, Dempsey Farnsworth and Larry Farnsworth, both of Summerfield, and Hubert Farnsworth and Clayton Farnsworth, both of Lewisville; and several grandchildren.
He was preceded in death by his parents and one sister, Martha Cline.
Memorial graveside services will be held at the convenience of the family in Calais Cemetery in Calais. Brubach-Watters Funeral Home in Summerfield is in charge of arrangement

2002
Reusser, Helen A. (Stalder)
SOURCE: Canton Repository . . . .Canton, OH . . . Wed 28 Aug 2002
Helena A. Reusser, age 89 of Canton, OH passed away Tuesday morning (27 Aug 02) in Aultman Hospital following a brief illness. Born in Sardis, OH on August 13, 1913 she had been a resident of Canton since 1951. She was a retired employee of Aultman Hospital, retiring in 1979 after 23 year of service. She was a member of the Church of the Lakes United Methodist and was involved with many of the groups within the church. She was a volunteer at the Total Living Center on Tuesday evenings and a member of the Edgefield Chapter #2267 AARP. She was preceded in death by her husband, Isaac G. Reusser who passed away April 7, 1993. Survivors include her three children and their spouses; Clinton and Gertrude Reusser of Canton, Wayne and Starr Reusser of Massillon and Karen and David Volak of Canton; one brother, Glen Stalder of Sardis, OH; there are eight grandchildren; seven great-grandchildren; three step-granddaughters; five step-great-grandchildren and two step-great-great grandchildren. Funeral services will be conducted Friday at 1 p.m. in the Church of the Lakes United Methodist with Pastor Bryan George officiating. Burial will be in Sunset Hills Memory Gardens. Calling hours at the church prior to services on Friday from 11-1 p.m. The Reed Funeral Home is in charge of arrangements. In lieu of flowers memorial donations may be made to the Church of the Lakes United Methodist.

Sept. 25, 2002 Marietta Times
Violet Bott , nee Anderson
WOODSFIELD - Violet Bott, 83, of Lewisville Road, Woodsfield, died Sunday (Sept. 22, 2002) at The Ohio State University Hospital in Columbus.
She was born Aug. 31, 1919, in Monroe County to Albert "Al" and Lucinda Nalley Anderson. She was the owner of Violet's Beauty Shop in Woodsfield for 65 years. She was a member of the Woodsfield Church of Christ; Illdreth Rebekah Lodge 842 (past chief); Pythian Sisters Lodge of Woodsfield (past noble grand); and a 55-year member of Center Grange.
She is survived by one son, John Bott of Woodsfield; and one brother-in-law, Ellis Bott of Marietta.
She was preceded in death by her husband, Guy E. Bott, who died in January 1996; and her parents.
Services are at 1 p.m. Thursday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home in Woodsfield. Burial is in Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield. Visitation is from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. today at the funeral home, with a Rebekah Lodge service at 8 p.m.

Marietta Times - Sept. 25 2002
Wanda L. Clegg Standifer, nee Ollom
WOODSFIELD - Wanda L. Clegg Standifer, 86, of Ohio 536, Woodsfield, died Monday (Sept. 23, 2002) at the Ohio Valley Medical Center in Wheeling, W.Va.
She was born Sept. 8, 1916, in Monroe County to Lawrence Ollom and Gertrude Bandi Ollom. She was a member of Chapel Hill United Methodist Church.
She is survived by one daughter, Karen McKelvey and her husband, Kenneth, of Woodsfield; two sisters, Verla Lude of Woodsfield and Inez McClellan of Woodsfield; two grandchildren, Brenda Roberts and her husband, Jim, of Woodsfield and Mike McKelvey of Woodsfield; two great-grandchildren, Justin and Chelsie Roberts; and two nephews, Gary McClellan and her husband, Cindy, of Woodsfield and Jerry McClellan of Woodsfield.
She was preceded in death by her first husband, Bernard Clegg, in 1958; her second husband, Cecil Standifer, in 1987.
Services are at 1 p.m. Friday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home in Woodsfield with the Rev. James Porter and Paul Eddy officiating. Burial is in Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield. Friends will be received from 4 to 9 p.m. Thursday and from 10 a.m. until the time of service Friday at the funeral home.

======================
Columbus Dispatch Sunday, September 29, 2002
SMITHBERGER In loving memory of Ralph W. Smithberger, age 84, of Columbus, Oh., who passed away peacefully September 26, 2002. Born November 8, 1917, in Bethel Township, Monroe County, Oh. A graduate of Bethel Township High School, Monroe County, Oh. in 1935 and attended Marietta Ohio Business College. Enlisted July 2, 1941, in U.S. Army Air Corps at Patterson Field in Dayton, Oh. and served for 5 years, including 1 year overseas during WW II in aerial combat as a 2nd Lieutenant and B-17 navigator in US 8th Air Force, 95th Bomb Group, 334th Squadron, Horsham, England. Shot down by German FW-190s on fifth bombing run to Leipzig, Germany and crash landed on May 29, 1944, near Wittenberg, Germany. Imprisoned for 8 months in Stalag Luft III at Sagan, location of the Hollywood movie, The Great Escape, and in Stalag 7A at Moosburg. Liberated by troops of the 3rd Army 14th Armored Division under the command of General George S. Patton on April 29, 1945. Awarded the Purple Heart and European African Middle Eastern Campaign Medals. Served in Air Force Reserves November 1945 to May 1949 and Ohio National Guard, May 1949 to May 1951 during the Korean War. Featured in an article, World War II Vet Tastes Freedom Anew, in the Columbus Dispatch on April 29, 1995. Employed 40 years with Franklin County Engineering Department, US Veterans Administration and Farm Bureau Cooperative Association. Member of Our Lady of Victory Parish and recipient of Columbus Diocese Catholic Bishop's Award. Co-author of A History of the Smithberger Family in America, 1840-1982 and President of the annual Smithberger reunion for 18 years. Preceded in death by parents Clemens Paul Smithberger and Elizabeth Theresa Arnold Smithberger, brother Harold, sister-in-law Melba Blowers Smithberger and son-in-law Donald Barringer. Survived by former wife, Lucille Handley Smithberger, Columbus, Oh.; 3 daughters, Karen (Daniel) Royer, Columbus, Oh., Mary Smithberger, Sacramento, Calif. and Rita (Thomas) Heiby, Upper Arlington, Oh.; 2 sons, Joseph (Linda) Smithberger, Pickerington, Oh. and Thomas (Janis) Smithberger, Falls Church, Va.; brother, Paul, Marion, Oh. Also survived by 10 grandchildren; 9 great-grandchildren. He will be remembered for his love of family and friends, devotion to his faith, and service to his country. Family will receive friends on Sunday during visiting hours from 2-5 p.m. with a prayer service at 4:30 p.m. at EGAN-RYAN FUNERAL HOME, 403 E. Broad St. A Funeral Mass will be celebrated at Our Lady of Victory Church on Monday at 10 a.m. followed by interment at Resurrection Cemetery, 9571 North High St. Family and friends will gather at Our Lady of Victory Church following the burial. In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions may be sent to Our Lady of Victory Church, 1559 Roxbury Rd. or St. Raphael's Home for the Aged, 1550 Roxbury Rd., Columbus, Oh. 43212.

Lena Hannahs, nee Huntsman
October 5, 2002
    Lena Hannahs , 83 , of Barnesville, died Saturday, ( October 5, 2002)
at her residence.
    She was born October 24, 1918, in Somerton, a daughter of the late Lester and Myrtle Stephen Huntsman.
    She was a retired seamstress and beautician and a member of The First Christian Church.
    She was preceded in death by her husband, Frank H. Hannahs; three brothers, Francis, Delbert and Roger Huntsman and a granddaughter, Tammy Jo Crawford.
   She leaves one son, Sam ( Valerie) Hannahs of Barnesville; a daughter, Mrs. William ( Nancy ) Crawford of Bethesda; three sisters, Ruby Hannahs, Melba Swallie and Joan Gallagher, all of Barnesville, six grandchildren, Tina Marie Greenwood and Mark,  Marie, Michelle,Amanda, Joaad Nathaniel Hannahs, and seven great-grandchildren.
   Friends were received Sunday at Campbell-Plumly- Milburn Funeral Home in Barnesville where services were held Monday with the Rev. Ed Eberhart officiating.
   Burial was in Crestview Cemetery.

Tubaugh, Richard G. Tubaugh
SOURCE: Marietta Times . . . Marietta, OH . . . Oct 2002 . . . NLY
BEALLSVILLE - Richard G. Tubaugh, 63, of Beallsville died Tuesday (Oct. 15, 2002) at Barnesville Hospital.
He was born March 9, 1939, in Martins Ferry to Carl and Lela Jackson Tubaugh. He was a carpenter with Marquart Inc. in Wheeling, W.Va., and was a member of Carpenters Local 3 in Wheeling.
He is survived by his wife of 42 years, Myrna Lough Tubaugh; three sons, R. Allan (Nancy) Tubaugh of Marietta, Donnie Tubaugh of Columbus and Rick (Tina) Tubaugh of Beallsville; one daughter, Renee (Keith) Beymer of Dayton; two brothers, Junior and Harley Tubaugh, both of Ravenna; and 13 grandchildren.
He was preceded in death by his parents; one brother, Harry Tubaugh; and one sister, Alice Lallathin.
Services are at 1 p.m. Thursday at Harper Funeral Home in Beallsville with Pastor George Passmore officiating. Burial is in Jerusalem Cemetery. Friends will be received from 5 to 9 p.m. today at the funeral home.

Name: David W. McGarry
Source: The Marietta Times
Issue: Marietta, OH, October 17, 2002
David W. McGarry, 39, of 52344 Ohio 800, Malaga, Ohio died Tuesday evening (Oct. 15, 2002) near Malaga from injuries he received in an automobile accident.
He was born Aug. 12, 1963, in Bellaire to Franklin and Betty Saffell McGarry Sr. He was a foreman for Asplundh Tree Service in Pennsylvania. He was a Protestant by faith.
He is survived by his wife, Kathy Peck McGarry, whom he married on Feb. 11, 1981; one son, Joshua David McGarry at home; his parents of Woodsfield; two sisters, Marsha McGarry of Bridgeport and Cindy Parden and her husband, Bill, of Woodsfield; two brothers, Frank McGarry Jr. of Woodsfield and John McGarry and his wife, Diane, of New Concord; and several nieces and nephews.
Services are at 11 a.m. Friday at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield with Pastor Lloyd Hill officiating. Burial is in Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield. Friends will be received from 6 to 9 p.m. today at the funeral home.

2002
Jacqueline Rae Pfalzgraf, nee Laatsch
January 29, 1944 - October 27, 2002
Birthplace: Oshkosh
Resided In: Oshkosh Wisconsin USA
Funeral Home: Konrad-Behlman Funeral Homes More Info/Directions
Visitation: October 30, 2002 More Info/Directions
Service: October 31, 2002 More Info/Directions
Cemetery: Nepeuskum Cemetery More Info/Directions
 
Jacqueline R. Pfalzgraf, 58, of Oshkosh died on Sunday, October 27, 2002 at Mercy Medical Center. She was born on January 29, 1944 in Oshkosh the daughter of Raymond and Verna Rumlow Laatsch. Jacqueline was married to Carl Pfalzgraf on November 15, 1968 in Oshkosh. She enjoyed Bingo very much and was an honorary member of the Marine Corps Bingo League.
Survivors include her husband, Carl; father and step-mother, Raymond and Mary Laatsch of Oshkosh; three children, Jeffrey (Barb) Pfalzgraf, Brian Pfalzgraf and Julie Pfalzgraf all of Oshkosh; ten grandchildren, Travis, Tyler, Joseph, McKenzie, Rainie, Amber, Jamie and Courtney Pfalzgraph, Dustin Drew and Harley Moderson; and a special friend, Fritz.
Jacqueline was preceded in death by her mother; sister, Nancy Larson and a granddaughter, Stephanie.
The funeral service will be on Thursday, October 31, 2002 at 11:00 AM at the Konrad-Behlman Funeral Home (eastside) with the Rev. Ralph Hanusa officiating. Family and friends may call at the funeral home on Wednesday from 4:00 PM to 8:00 PM and on Thursday from 10:00 AM to the time of service. Burial will be in Nepeuskum Cemetery.
The family would like to thank the staff of the Emergency Room at Mercy Medical Center and Chaplin Phil Dewitt for the care she received.
In Lieu of flowers a memorial has been established

The Marietta Times
Marietta, Ohio, Tuesday, October 29, 2002
John W. Price
MALONE, Fla. - John W. Price, 80, of Malone, Florida, formerly of Woodsfield, died Sunday, Oct. 20, 2002, at his home in Malone after a brief illness.
He was born Feb. 20, 1922, in Woodsfield to Clarence E. and Hazel Gillispie Price. He was a past general chairman of the United Transportation Union. He was a veteran of the African and European Theaters of Operations during World War II. He was an avid golfer for more than 70 years.
He is survived by his wife of 55 years, Jeannie Cline Price; one son and daughter-in-law, John and Jodi Grimm Price; one daughter, Stephanie and Nathan Shimer; six grandchildren, Kelli Price Chawla, Christian Price, Stacie McGarry Grose, Schuyler McGarry Strawser, Laura Shimer and Nik Shimer; and three great-grandchildren, Victoria Strawser, Rebecca Grose and Seth Grose.
He was preceded in death by his parents.
Services are at 1 p.m. Saturday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home in Woodsfield with the Rev. Richard Wilson officiating. Full military graveside services will be in Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield conducted by the Belmont Veterans Council.
Visitation is from 2 to 4:30 and 6 to 8:30 p.m. Wednesday through Friday at the home of Mildred Cline Fliehman on Lewisville Road, Woodsfield.

2002
Lallathin, Hazel Beatrice
SOURCE: Marietta Times . . . Marietta, OH . . . Oct 2002
WOOSTER - Hazel Beatrice Lallathin, 90, a former resident of Marietta, died early Wednesday morning (Oct. 30, 2002) at Wooster Hospital in Wooster, Ohio.
Her home had been at Rinard Mills and later in Marietta before going to Wooster 11 years ago to be cared for after receiving injuries in a fall at her home in Marietta. She had been a resident of Shady Lawn Nursing Home for 11 years.
She was born Sept. 15, 1912, in Rinard Mills to Elmer and Anna Ullman Lallathin. She spent her early years in Rinard Mills before moving with her mother to Marietta. She had been employed at Marietta Laundry for several years. She was a member of Rinard Mills United Methodist Church.
She is survived by three sisters, Leora Griffin of Marietta and Bernice Graham and Wilma Lucas, both of Wooster; and a number of nieces and nephews.
She was preceded in death by her parents and one brother, W.E. Lallathin.
Services are at 1 p.m. Saturday at McClure-Schafer-Lankford Funeral Home in Marietta with Pastors David Jackson and Barb Jackson officiating. Burial is in New Matamoras Cemetery. Friends may call at the funeral home from Friday morning until the hour of the service. The family will be present to meet friends from 6 to 8 p.m. Friday at the funeral home.

The Marietta Times
Marietta, Ohio, Friday, November 1, 2002
Robert C. Grimm
WOODSFIELD - Robert C. Grimm, 81, of Lickskillet Road died Thursday (Oct. 31, 2002) at Barnesville Hospital.
He was born Aug. 8, 1921, in Monroe County to Orlando B. Grimm and Mary Starr Grimm. He was a former employee of the Pennsylvania Railroad and was a retired employee of Montgomery Ward in Fort Wayne, Ind.
An Army veteran of World War II, he served three years in the Asiatic-Pacific Theater. He was a Presbyterian by faith.
He is survived by his former wife, Floi Parr Grimm and family of Fort Wayne; two sisters, Betty Paulus of Woodsfield and Helen Marsh and her husband, Dana, of Columbus; four nieces, Marilyn Paulus, Christine Boyers, Mary Ann Janes and Claudia Staley; and four nephews, Frank Paulus, Ralph Paulus, James Janes and Claude Alan Janes.
There will be no visitation. Graveside military services will be conducted at Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield at the convenience of the family.
Memorial contributions may be made to the Monroe County Emergency Squad, P.O. Box 653, Lewisville Road, Woodsfield, Ohio 43793.

2002
Rodney D. Wheeler
Rodney D. Wheeler, 45, of Bethesda, died Wednesday (Nov. 6, 2002) in Columbus.  He was born May 22, 1957, in Alliance, son of Mrs. Cliff (Sylvia) Huntsman Spencer and the late Samuel H. Wheeler.  Mr. Wheeler was an employee of Seminole Tubular in Cambridge and was a member of the East Main Street Church of Christ.
He was preceded in death by his grandparents, Stanley and Laura Wheeler and Earl Huntsman.
He leaves his loving wife, Jennifer (Sampson) Wheeler, a son Bradley Wheeler of the home; two sisters, Amy and Stephanie of the home; two brothers, David Wheeler of Bethesda and Samuel W. Wheeler of north Carolina; and his grandmother Edna Huntsman of St. Clairsville.
Calling hours were held Saturday.  Services were held Sunday at Campbell-Plumly-Milburn Funeral Home, Barnesville. Burial followed in Crestview cemetery, Barnesville.  Memorial contributions may be made to Quaker City volunteer fire department.
 
 
=====================

Cambridge, Ohio,Thursday, November 7, 2002

Pastor Loran Dace will officiate. Burial will be in Olive Cemetery, Caldwell.
Friends may call from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. today at the funeral home in Summerfield.

Hubbard: Opal Dallas (Hissom)
SOURCE: Marietta Times . . . Marietta, OH . . . Nov 2002
Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
SARDIS - Opal Dallas Hubbard, 99, of the Monroe County Care Center, formerly of Sardis, died Saturday (Nov. 9, 2002).
She was born Oct. 20, 1903, in Fly to Elsom and Lucinda Billiter Hissom.
She was preceded in death by her husband, Howard Hissom; her parents; and one brother, Noah Hissom.
She is survived by three children, Doris M. Miller, Mrs. Max (Lavina) Nuzum and Buford Hubbard, all of Sardis; four grandchildren, Mrs. Alvin (Connie) Thompson of Woodsfield, Mrs. Jim (Becky) Harrigan of Sardis, Micky Hubbard and his wife, Cindy, of Cambridge, and Cassandra "Cassie" Hubbard of Sardis; and three great-grandchildren, Neil Thompson of Marietta College, Jared Thompson of Woodsfield and Brittney Harrigan of Sardis.

The Marietta Times
Marietta, Ohio, Tuesday, November 12, 2002
Alice McIntire Hugi
CLARINGTON - Alice McIntire Hugi, 95, of Sykes Ridge Road died Sunday (Nov. 10, 2002) at Barnesville Hospital in Barnesville.
She was born June 5, 1907, in Monroe County to James and Missouri Eikleberry Haslam.
She is survived by one son, Charles R. McIntire of Clarington; two daughters, Florence Mason of Whitehall and Martha Highley of Weirton, W.Va.; two brothers, Russell Haslam of Woodsfield and Charles Schilling of Clarington; two sisters, Ida Stewart of Orrville and Marjorie Shafer of Canton; 13 grandchildren; and several great-grandchildren and great-great-grandchildren.
She was preceded in death by her first husband, James McIntire; her second husband, Charles Hugi; five children, Ray, Roy, George and Harry McIntire, and Dale Hugi; her parents; and three brothers, Chester, Glenn and Robert Haslam.

The Marietta Times
Marietta, Ohio, Tuesday, November 12, 2002
Thelma M. Weber, nee Ackerman
WOODSFIELD - Thelma M. Weber, 89, of West Church Street died Sunday (Nov. 10, 2002) at the Monroe County Care Center.
She was born Feb. 15, 1913, in Monroe County to Henry and Birdie Ackerman. She was retired from the Woodsfield school district and worked as a "Gray Lady" with the Barnesville Hospital Ladies Auxiliary for 31 years.
She was a member of the Woodsfield Homemakers, Eastern Star Lodge 268, Pythian Sisters and Woodsfield Veterans of Foreign Wars Auxiliary. She was also a member of St. Paul's United Church of Christ at Woodsfield, where she served on the Women's Guild, church council, and United Church of Christ Larger Parish.
She is survived by her husband of 70 years, Leighton Weber, they were married December 19, 1931; one daughter, Helen Marie Ring and her husband, Paul, of Woodsfield; one sister, Dorthea Burkhardt of Columbus; four grandchildren, Paula Ring (Bill Frank), Marc Ring (Helen Kay Ring), Matthew Ring (Greg Woods) and Andrew Ring (Lori Ring); and five great-grandchildren, Magan, Marissa, Zachary, Kelsey and Jacob Ring.
She was preceded in death by her parents; two brothers, Abraham and Francis Ackerman; and four sisters, Deloris Thompson, Helen Pickens, Estella Taylor and Pauline Benton.
Services are at 1 p.m. Thursday at St. Paul's United Church of Christ at Woodsfield with the Rev. Richard Wilson officiating. Burial is in Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield. Friends will be received from 2 to 9 p.m. Wednesday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home in Woodsfield. Eastern Star Lodge services are at 7:30 p.m. Wednesday at the funeral home.
Memorial contributions may be made to St. Paul's United Church of Christ, 303 S. Main St., Woodsfield, Ohio 43793.

The Marietta Times
Marietta, Ohio, Monday November 18, 2002
Betty Louise Eddy Gearhart
Betty Louise Eddy Gearhart, 60, of Woodsfield Road, Marietta Route 5, died Saturday (Nov. 16, 2002) from injuries received in an accident.
She was born Oct. 29, 1942, in Canton to Earl F. and Bertha Metts Eddy. She was a 1961 graduate of Lawrence High School and had been employed as a seamstress at Wieser and Cawley Furniture Store for 25 years.
She attended Souls Harbor Baptist Church, where she was a member of the choir and had also worked with the Ladies Fellowship of the church in making Bibles for missionaries to distribute overseas in Seed Line Ministries. She had collected salt and pepper shakers since the early 1960s. She also enjoyed making quilts and sewing.
She is survived by her husband, Robert L. Gearhart, whom she married on July 25, 1959; one son, David Gearhart of Marietta; one daughter, Diana F. Gearhart Bennett and her husband, Wayne, of Marietta; two granddaughters, Amber L. Bennett McDougal and her husband, Joshua, and Amy R. Bennett, both of Marietta; two sisters, Shirley Eddy Dowdy and her husband, Robert, of Brandon, Fla., and Barbara Eddy Reeder of Marietta; one brother, Robert Eddy of Atlanta, Ga.; one sister-in-law, Bonnie McGraw of Marietta; and several nephews and nieces.
She was preceded in death by her parents; one brother, Thomas Eddy; and one brother-in-law, C. Edward Reeder, who died Oct. 28, 2002.
Services are at 10 a.m. Wednesday at Souls Harbor Baptist Church with Pastor Robert Hughes officiating. Burial is in East Lawn Memorial Park. Friends may call at McClure-Schafer-Lankford Funeral Home in Marietta from 4 p.m. today until Wednesday morning and at the church for one hour prior to the services. The family will be present to meet friends from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Tuesday.
 
=====================
The Marietta Times
Marietta, Ohio, Wednesday, November 20, 2002
Neil C. Weisend
WOODSFIELD - Neil C. Weisend, 86, of 117 Home Ave., died at 10:15 a.m. Tuesday (Nov. 19, 2002) at his home.
He was born Aug. 4, 1916, near Lewisville to Clem and Josephine Naver Weisend. He was a retired maintenance engineer for the former Consolidated Aluminum Corp. at Hannibal. He was a member of St. Sylvester Catholic Church at Woodsfield, where he was a member of the Purgatorial Society, St. Francis Society and the Holy Name Society. He was also a former 3rd degree member of the former Knights of Columbus, Chapter 5009.
He is survived by his wife, Margery E. Yeagle Weisend, whom he married on Dec. 30, 1939; three daughters, Jan Hunt and her husband, Alan, of Marietta, Doris Mallett and her husband, Merle, of Columbus and Judith Weisend of Green, Ohio; two sons, Robert Weisend and his wife, Irene, of Portland, Ore., and Rich Weisend of Reno, Ohio; two sisters, Rita Gallagher of Temperanceville, Ohio, and Mary Crites of Massillon; 15 grandchildren; nine great-grandchildren; five step grandchildren; eight step great-grandchildren; and several nieces and nephews.
He was preceded in death by one son, Donald Weisend, on Oct. 19, 1969; his parents; an infant sister, Emma Weisend; one sister, Hilda Zwick; and three brothers, Harold, Paul and Lyle Weisend.
Funeral liturgy with Mass will be celebrated at 11 a.m. Saturday at St. Sylvester Catholic Church at Woodsfield with the Rev. David Gaydosik officiating. Burial is in St. Sylvester Catholic Cemetery at Woodsfield. Vigil services are at 8:30 p.m. Friday at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield.
Memorial contributions may be made to N.A.V. Sisters of Our Lady of Charity, P.O. Box 158, Carrollton, Ohio 44615; or to St. Sylvester Catholic School, 119 Wayne St., Woodsfield, Ohio 43793.

The Marietta Times
Marietta, Ohio, Monday, November 25, 2002
Franklin Donato
GRAYSVILLE - Franklin Donato, 73, of Pleasant Ridge, Graysville, died Sunday (Nov. 24, 2002) at the Arbors of Marietta.
He was born March 31, 1929, in Sand Hill, Marshall County, W.Va., to Samuel Donato and Anna Dolak Donato. He was an auto mechanic, a farmer, and a Presbyterian by faith.
He is survived by his wife, Linda Donato of Graysville; three sons, Franklin "Buster" Donato of Mohawk Valley, N.C., Robert K. Donato of Kentucky and Robert F. Donato of Rinard Mills; six daughters, Ramona Gulino of New Jersey, Barbara Ann Donato of Brooklyn, N.Y., Rhonda Templeton of Woodsfield, Joyce Benegar of Newport, Sherry Donato of Williamstown and Angela Levan of Graysville; three brothers, Samuel Donato of Ohio, Joseph Donato of Sand Hill, W.Va., and Ray "Butch" Donato of Sand Hill; six sisters, Helen Cantaberry, Marie McCullery, Virginia Powroznyk and Shirley Edge, all of Ohio, Edna Ritchea of West Virginia and Helen Deskavick; 22 grandchildren; 15 great-grandchildren; and 45 nieces and nephews.
He was preceded in death by one brother, Dave Donato; and his parents.
Memorial services are at 11 a.m. Wednesday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home in Woodsfield. Burial will be at the convenience of the family. Friends will be received from 10 a.m. Wednesday until the time of service at the funeral home.

======================
Monroe County Beacon:
Beallsville Mayor Dies at Home
Beallsville Mayor Roger Warren, 62, died at his Beallsville home Sunday, Dec. 1, losing his battle against cancer.
Warren will always be remembered for his dedication to his hometown and his county.
 
Serving as mayor of Beallsville for 12 years, Warren has also served as a member of the Beallsville Village Council. He was a member of the Beallsville Volunteer Fire Department, the Farm Bureau, was a member of the Issue 2 Committee, and the Guernsey-Monroe-Noble Community Action Commis-sion Board of Directors. Warren was a Monroe County Democratic Central committeeman and a member of Sunsbury Lodge F&AM No. 362 in Beallsville. He also served as a member and president of the Monroe County Community Improvement Corporation.
 
He was retired from Ormet Corporation, Hannibal.
 
Warren leaves his wife, Carol Jean Decker Warren, whom he married Oct. 20, 1962, two sons, daughters-in-law and four grandchildren.
 
Services were held Dec. 4 at Harper Funeral Home, Beallsville, with burial at Beallsville Cemetery.

The Marietta Times
Marietta, Ohio, Saturday, December 7, 2002
Ella L. Walter,nee Gauding
WOODSFIELD - Ella L. Walter, 107, of Woodsfield, died Friday (Dec. 6, 2002) at the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center.
She was born Sept. 15, 1895, in Lee Township, Monroe County, near Sardis, to Samuel and Caroline Hoefer Gauding. She was a lifelong member of St. Paul's United Church of Christ at Woodsfield.
She is survived by two sons, Raymond Walter of Columbus and Kenneth Walter and his wife, Mae Jeanne, of San Jose, Calif.; one daughter, Dorothy Moore and her husband, Ray, of Columbus; nine grandchildren; 14 great-grandchildren; two great-great-grandchildren; and several nieces and nephews.
She was preceded in death by her husband, Jacob R. Walter, who died in 1981; one daughter, Marjorie Morris; one son-in-law, Robert Morris; one daughter-in-law, Neva Walter; three brothers, Ferd, Henry and John Gauding; and three sisters, Mary Suter, Emma Ensinger and Rose Gauding.
Services are at 2 p.m. Sunday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, with the Rev. Clifton Garris officiating. Burial is in Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield. Friends will be received from 1 p.m. Sunday until the time of service at the funeral home.
Memorial contributions may be made to St. Paul's United Church of Christ, 303 S. Main St., Woodsfield, Ohio 43793.

Marietta Times
Marietta, OH, Thurs, Dec 1, 2002
Norbert E. Schumacher
WOODSFIELD - Norbert E. Schumacher, 68, of 47295 Moore Ridge Road died at 2:46 p.m. Tuesday (Dec. 17, 2002) at the University of Pittsburgh Medical Center, Presbyterian Hospital, in Pittsburgh, Pa.
He was born Dec. 23, 1933, near Woodsfield to Leo and Barbara Weisend Schumacher. He was a retired farmer.
A U.S. Army veteran, he served during World War II. He was a member of St. Sylvester Catholic Church in Woodsfield, a former board member of Monroe Soil and Water Conservation, a member of Monroe County Farm Bureau, a former board member of Landmark, a former board member of the A.S.C.S. in Monroe County, and a former member of the Holstein Dairy Association.
He is survived by his wife, Ada Harmon Schumacher, whom he married on April 8, 1967; three sisters, Sister Evelyn Ann Schumacher of Manitowac, Wis., Lucille Block of Cincinnati, and Evelyn King and her husband, Paul, of Beverly; one brother, William Schumacher and his wife, Carol, of Woodsfield; and several nieces and nephews.
He was preceded in death by an infant son, David Lee Schumacher; his parents; his stepmother, Marie Schumacher; four brothers, Lawrence, Charles, Ambrose and Gilbert Schumacher; and one sister, Mary Jennings.
Funeral liturgy with Mass will be celebrated at 11 a.m. Saturday at St. Sylvester Catholic Church in Woodsfield with the Rev. David Gaydosik as celebrant. Burial will be in St. Sylvester Catholic Cemetery in Woodsfield with full military graveside services to be conducted by the Belmont Veterans Council. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Friday at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield, where vigil services will be conducted at 8:30 p.m. Friday.
Memorial contributions may be made to St. Sylvester Catholic School, 119 Wayne St., Woodsfield, Ohio 43793.

2002
Lillian Riggenbach nee Wenham
          Lillian V. Riggenbach, 97, Ravenna, died Dec. 8, 2002, at her home.  She was born Feb 22, 1905, in Donora, PA, a daughter of the late Isaac E. And Martha Ann Carpenter Wenham.  She lived in Ravenna since 1925.
          She was a homemaker and worked at Annevar Mills, in Ravenna, and the food services department at Kent State University.  She attended First Christian Church of Ravenna and was a member of Ravenna Senior Citizens.
          Surviving are her daughter, Betty Ann, of Ravenna; three grandchildren; six great-grandchildren.
          In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her husband, Edward A., who died in 1991; a son, Preston, in 1990; brothers, Russell and Clayton.
          There were no calling hours.  Services were held Dec. 10 at Maple Grove Cemetery Chapel in Ravenna, with Rev. Bruce Chouinard officiating.  Burial was in Maple Grove Cemetery.  Shorts Funeral Home, Ravenna Chapel, handled arrangements.
          Memorial contributions may be made to Robinson Memorial Hospital VNA and Hospice or Boys Village, Smithville, OH 44677-0518.

The Marietta Times
Marietta, OH, Sat. Dec. 21, 2002
Catherine Copeland Stine, nee Covert
WOODSFIELD - Catherine Copeland Stine, 82, of Plainview Road, died Friday (Dec. 20, 2002) at Barnesville Hospital.
She was born April 5, 1920, at Plainview Road, Monroe County, to James O. and Cora Blazer Covert. She was a homemaker and a member of Plainview Church of Christ.
She was preceded in death by her first husband, William Lloyd Copeland, in 1988; two sisters, Gladys Dometrovich and Martha Stine; and two brothers, Norman Covert and George Stanley Covert.
She is survived by one son, Steven Copeland and his wife, Patricia, of Woodsfield; her second husband, Robert D. Stine of Wooster; two stepchildren; six sisters, Edna Petty of Wooster, Flossie Lemasters of Moundsville, W.Va., Ruth Pickens of Point Pleasant, W.Va., Nellie Conaway of Sommerdale, Allie Stacy of Canton and Zelma Merckle of Holmesville; one brother, Gilbert Covert of Woodsfield; and three grandchildren, Jessica, Jason and Alicia Copeland.
Services are at 11 a.m. Monday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, with Keith Jones officiating. Burial is in Plainview Cemetery near Woodsfield. Friends may call from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Sunday at the funeral home.

Raymond K. Kuhn
SOURCE: Times Leader . . . Martins Ferry, OH, dated, 24 Dec 2002 
(Raymond K. Kuhn was born on 27 Oct 1919 in Burkhart Station, Monroe Co., OH. He died on 23 Dec 2002 in Barnesville, Belmont Co., OH.)
Raymond K. Kuhn, 83, Barnesville, died Monday at the Barnesville Health Care Center. He was born Oct. 27, 1919 at Burkhart Station, son of the late Leo and Eleanor (Crum) Kuhn. He was an Army veteran of World War II; a retired truck driver for M&K and Pomco; a member of Assumption Catholic Church, K of C and VFW Post 2792.Preceded by wife, Helen Marie (Schafer) Kuhn; and brothers, Herman, Mike, Ted and Earl.
Surviving are a son, Paul Kuhn of Barnesville; daughter, Mrs. Richard (Rita) Hall of Barnesville;brothers, John and Bernard Kuhn of Zanesville; sisters, Mrs. Gilbert (Mary) Bowman of Zanesville and Laura Harrell of Fitzgerald, Ga.; grandchildren, Rusty Hall and wife Laura of Chicago and Rachael Weis and husband Brian of Powell, Ohio.; and a great-grandchild, Vanessa Renee Weis.
Friends received 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Thursday at Campbell-Plumly-Milburn Funeral Home, 319 N. Chestnut St., Barnesville, Ohio and at Assumption Catholic Church, Barnesville, Friday from 9 a.m. until time of Mass at 11 a.m., with the Rev. Virgil Reischman. Burial follows in Crestview Cemetery, Barnesville. Full military honors conducted by Belmont County Council of the VFW.

The Marietta Times
Marietta, Ohio, Saturday, December 28, 2002
Eugene Frank Swallow
NEW MATAMORAS - Eugene Frank Swallow, 77, formerly of Riverpark Manor in New Matamoras, died at 9:12 p.m. Thursday (Dec. 26, 2002) at the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center.
He was born July 28, 1925, in Benton Township, Monroe County, to John Wesley and Clara Belle Stacy Swallow. He was a self-employed painter and was a member of Harmony Hill Baptist Church in Brownsville. He was a World War II Navy veteran.
He is survived by two sisters, Vera Mae Swallow of Barnesville and Alice McEwen of Wheeling, W.Va.; one brother, Elmer Gale Swallow of New Matamoras; and several nieces and nephews.
He was preceded in death by his parents; two brothers, Clifford and George Swallow; and three sisters, Mary and Elizabeth Ellen Swallow and Carrie Rinard.
Services are at 11 a.m. Monday at Hadley Funeral Home, New Matamoras. Burial is in Brownsville United Methodist Cemetery. The family will receive friends from 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m. Sunday at the funeral home. Military services will be conducted at the graveside.

          Josephine Dennis, 90, Clarington, died Friday, Dec. 20, 2002 at New Martinsville Health Care Center.  She was born Feb. 17, 1912 in Farr, W.Va. the daughter of the late William and Florida Conley Ueltschy.
          Survivors include four sons, Walter Lee Dennis, Gene (Linda) Dennis, Robert (Ethel) Dennis, and Gordon (Barbara) Dennis all of Clarington; two daughters, Virginia (Bill) Hanahan of Germantown, Ohio and Margery Schindler of Hannibal; three sisters, Minnie Butler, Clarington, Mabel Fish and Mary Ueltschy both of Woodsfield; 16 grandchildren, 21 great-grandchildren and several nieces and nephews.

2002
Creighton, Sr., John Robert "Bob"
SOURCE: Marietta Times . . . Marietta, Oh . . . Dec 2002
MATAMORAS - John Robert "Bob" Creighton Sr., 72, of 518 Third St., died at 12:47 a.m. Saturday (Dec. 28, 2002) at Marietta Memorial Hospital.
He was born March 14, 1930, in Monroe County to Harold F. "Ted" and Iva Amanda Petty Creighton. He graduated from Matamoras High School in 1948. He was a machinist and welder for Creighton Machine Shop. He was a member of Matamoras First Baptist Church and American Legion Post 378 at New Matamoras. He was a life member of Veterans of Foreign Wars Post 5108 at Marietta.
He is survived by his wife, Patricia J. Locke Creighton, whom he married on July 11, 1950; two daughters, Teresa Swan and her husband, Mike, of New Matamoras and Tammy Powell and her husband, Dave, of St. Marys, W.Va.; one son, John R. Creighton Jr. and his wife, Melanie, of New Matamoras; and grandchildren, Sara and Shana Swan of New Matamoras, Dawn and Joe Swan and Missy Factor, all of Columbus, Brittany, Lindsey and Lydia Powell, all of St. Marys, and John Paul Creighton, Coty Creighton and Tammy Wilfong, all of New Matamoras.
He was preceded in death by his parents; and one brother, Dean F. Creighton, on Aug. 16, 1999.
Services are at 11 a.m. Tuesday at Hadley Funeral Home, New Matamoras, with the Rev. Rick Smith officiating. Burial is in Matamoras Cemetery. The family will receive friends from 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m. today at the funeral home.
Memorial contributions may be made to Matamoras First Baptist Church, P.O. Box 566, New Matamoras.
 
=====================
2003
DEATH
Name: Harlan E. CLEVELAND
Source: The Marietta Times
Marietta, Ohio, January 2, 2003
YUKON, Okla. - Harlan E. Cleveland, 81, of Yukon died Saturday (Dec. 28, 2002) after a lengthy illness.
He was born Oct. 22, 1921, in Cambridge to Tony and Mary Wehr Waggle Cleveland. His home was later in Marietta for several years and, during this period, he was employed at the Leader Restaurant and later in the restaurant at the Hotel Lafayette.
He enlisted in the U.S. Air Force and retired as a technical sergeant after 29 years. He then began a second career with the U.S. Postal Service in Lubbock, Texas, as a clerk. He was later transferred in 1972 to Kalamazoo, Mich., where he remained until his retirement in 1987.
After the death of his wife, he visited with his daughter in Oklahoma each winter from October until May when he would return to Kalamazoo. In 1998, he moved to the Mustang/Yukon area of Oklahoma and made visits to all of his children's homes in the area and shared time with his grandchildren. He enjoyed talking with people wherever he went.
During World War II, he was in the Marshall and Marianna Island campaigns and the Battle of Okinawa. He also served in both the Korean conflict and the Vietnam War. During his career in the military, he and his wife lived and traveled in many places within the continental United States and also in Alaska, Okinawa, Rhyuku Islands and Japan.
He was a member of the American Legion, 40&8, Veterans of Foreign Wars, Disabled American Veterans and Free and Accepted Masons.
He married Ruth Garnet Delaney of Marietta Jan. 5, 1947. She died Nov. 30, 1987.
He is survived by three daughters, Sharon Walls and her husband, Hal, of Yukon, Harla Hale and her husband, Glenn, of Abilene, Texas, and Sara Podwika and her husband, Tom, of Yukon; three sisters, Helen Miller of Zanesville, Bernetta Dotson of Marietta and Nancy Joyce of Iowa, La.; and 11 grandchildren.
 
=====================
2002
(Raymond K. Kuhn was born on 27 Oct 1919 in Burkhart Station, Monroe Co., OH. He died on 23 Dec 2002 in Barnseville, Belmont Co., OH.)
SOURCE: Times Leader . . . Martins Ferry, OH, dated, 24 Dec 2002 Raymond K. Kuhn, 83, Barnesville, died Monday at the Barnesville Health Care Center. He was born Oct. 27, 1919 at Burkhart Station, son of the late Leo and Eleanor (Crum) Kuhn. He was an Army veteran of World War II; a retired truck driver for M&K and Pomco; a member of Assumption Catholic Church, K of C and VFW Post 2792.Preceded by wife, Helen Marie (Schafer) Kuhn; and brothers, Herman, Mike, Ted and Earl.Surviving are a son, Paul Kuhn of Barnesville; daughter, Mrs. Richard (Rita) Hall of Barnesville; brothers, John and Bernard Kuhn of Zanesville; sisters, Mrs. Gilbert (Mary) Bowman of Zanesville and Laura Harrell of Fitzgerald, Ga.; grandchildren, Rusty Hall and wife Laura of Chicago and Rachael Weis and husband Brian of Powell, Ohio.; and a great-grandchild, Vanessa Renee Weis.Friends received 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Thursday at Campbell-Plumly-Milburn Funeral Home, 319 N. Chestnut St., Barnesville, Ohio and at Assumption Catholic Church, Barnesville, Friday from 9 a.m. until time of Mass at 11 a.m., with the Rev. Virgil Reischman. Burial follows in Crestview Cemetery, Barnesville.Full military honors conducted by Belmont County Council of the VFW.

DEATH
The Marietta Times
Marietta, Ohio, Friday, January 10, 2003
Edith D. Kenney,nee Loveall
WOODSFIELD - Edith D. Kenney, 75, of Ohio 800, Woodsfield (Antioch community), died Thursday (Jan. 9, 2003) at the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center.
She was born April 24, 1927, in Glen Dale, W.Va., to Walter F. and Clara E. Huff Loveall. She was a member of the Graysville Church of Christ.
She was preceded in death by her husband, Robert F. Kenney, in February 1998; her parents; one brother, Anthony Loveall; and three sisters, Virginia Burch, Mary Gura and Loretta Tallman.
She is survived by six sons, Robert F. Kenney Jr. and Gene Kenney, both of Newport, Gary Kenney of Byesville, David Kenney of New Philadelphia, Ohio, and Tim Kenney and Bill Kenney, both of Cambridge; five daughters, Sandra Resecker of Woodsfield, Joyce Gribble of New Philadelphia, Linda Stoehr of Cambridge, Connie Norris of Byesville and Kathy Gribble of New Philadelphia; one brother, Willard Loveall of New Martinsville, W.Va.; 22 grandchildren; and six great-grandchildren.
Services are at 1 p.m. Saturday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home at 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, with Minister Sam Bartrug officiating. Burial is in Antioch Cemetery in Antioch, Ohio. Friends will be received from 2 to 9 p.m. today at the funeral home.

2003
Monroe County Ceacon
December, 2002 Wedding
    Mrs. Kevin Edward Phillips 
 
Betsy Ann Day and Kevin Edward Phillips were united in marriage December 21 at the Woodsfield Church of Christ with Sam Bartrug and Keith Jones officiating.
 
The bride is the daughter of Ned and Deborah Day, Woodsfield. The bridegroom is the son of Monte and Mary Kay Phillips, Barnesville.
 
Erica Day, sister of the bride, served as maid of honor. Bridesmaids were Lori Rock-well, sister of the bridegroom, and Marisa Barricklow, Jill Keylor, Amy Griffin and Julie Kuhn, all friends of the bride. The bridegroom's cousin, Amanda Milburn, served as junior bridesmaid.
 
Darryl Rockwell, brother-in-law of the bridegroom, served as bestman. Groomsmen included Mathew and Ryan Milburn, cousins of the bridegroom and Matt Barricklow, Trevor Kaiser and Brock Rogers, all friends of the bridegroom.
 
Serving as ring bearers were Brady Rockwell, nephew of the bridegroom and Zachary Smith, cousin of the bride. Emily Rockwell, niece of the bride-           
groom was flower girl.
 
Images Photography was the photographer. A holiday reception at Swiss Hills Career Center immediately followed the ceremony. The couple enjoyed their first Christmas together at home with family and friends. Shortly after, they honeymooned at Canaan Valley Resort in West Virginia. Mr. and Mrs. Phillips reside in Woodsfield.

January 16, 2003
Monroe County beacon
Austin Brent Sloan - Birth
 
Hi! My name is Austin Brent Sloan. I was born Nov. 18, 2002, at Memorial Hospital, Marysville.
 
My very proud parents are Brent and Heather Sloan. I was welcomed home by my very special big sister, Alison. They were certainly glad to see me arrive safe and sound. We all live in Urbana.
 
My grandparents are Ray and Maria Sloan, Woodsfield, Laraine Sloan, Woodsfield, Janet Valkovic, Woodsfield, and Jim Valkovic, Beallsville.
 
My great-grandparents are Dorothy Valkovic, Beallsville, Ethel (Mo) Sloan and the late Ronald (Poco) Sloan, Woodsfield.
 
I would like to thank everyone for all the cards, gifts and visits. I also want to wish my Daddy a happy belated 26th birthday, Jan. 6, and a big happy seventh birthday to my big sister, Alison, Jan. 26. I am just going to enjoy all this attention and wait to see when my Uncle Terry and Aunt Ruthie give me a little cousin to play with.
 
======================
Samuel Burris Decker
Samuel Burris Decker was born Nov. 11, 2002, in Georgetown University Hospital, Washington, D.C., to Mark Decker, Jr. and Stephanie Marshik.
 
Mark, Jr. is the son of Mark Decker, Sr., former resident of Woodsfield and graduate of Woodsfield High School, and Molly McEwan Decker, formerly from Columbus. Sam's great-grandfather, now deceased, was Miles Burris "Bud" Decker, and his great-grandmother, also deceased, was Eloise Kremer Decker.
 
Mark, Jr. and Stephanie met in Washington, D.C., were married in 2001 and currently live in Arlington, Va.
 
Mark, Jr. is a graduate of the College of William and Mary in Williamsburg, Va., and currently is a real estate investment banker and vice president in the Capital Markets Group of Ferris, Baker Watts, Inc., a 100 year old investment banking and brokerage firm headquartered in Washington, D.C.
 
Stephanie is originally from Little Falls, Minnesota, and graduated from Concordia College, Minnesota. Sam looks forward to meeting the good people of Monroe County and will join his father and grandfather at one of the upcoming annual high school reunions.

Births
Monroe county beacon
Walker Kyle Reynolds
My name is Walker Kyle Reynolds and I was born two months early, on Dec. 17, 2002, at 9:10 p.m. at Ohio State University Hospital, Columbus. I weighed 2 lb. 13 oz. and was 15 3/4 inches long. I was transferred to Bethesda Hospital, Zanesville, for a week and a half then came home. I am now 4 1/2 lb. and 17 inches long and doing fine.
 
My proud parents are Craig and Tamara Reynolds, Quaker City. My two brothers, Wesley, five years old, and Wyatt, two years old, welcomed me home with open arms. They want to hold me all the time and spoil me.
 
My proud grandparents are Carol and Carl Hayes, Quaker City, Joyce and Roger Reynolds, Barnesville. My great-grandparents are Mary Hayes, Quaker City, and the late David Hayes, Gertrude Passwaters, Zanesville, and the late John Passwaters, Evaleen Shipley, Cambridge, and the late Orville Shipley, Beverly Reynolds, Barnesville, and the late Ted Reynolds, and the late Clarence and Laura Cunningham.
 
I have several aunts, uncles and cousins who think I am special.

DEATH
Name:
Source: The Marietta Times, Friday, January 17, 2003
James William Criswell
LEWISVILLE, Ohio - James William Criswell, 50, of Township Road 15, Lewisville, died Wednesday (Jan. 15, 2003) at his home.
He was born March 27, 1952, at Fort Bragg, N.C., to Linsly and Pat Stewart Criswell. He was a 1970 graduate of Shenandoah High School and a 1976 graduate of Bowling Green State University.
He was a former science, health and physical education teacher at Meadowbrook High School, where he also served as head wrestling coach and assistant football coach. He had also acted as wrestling coach at Shenandoah High School for one year. He had attended Whigville Community Church.
He is survived by one daughter, Emma Jo Criswell of Caldwell; his parents of Caldwell; one sister, Judy (Frank) Loraditch of Cumberland; and several nieces and nephews.
Services are at 1 p.m. Saturday at McVay-Perkins Funeral Home at 416 East St., Caldwell, with Pastor Cam Hayes and Pastor Gary Jacobs officiating. Burial is in Calais Cemetery. Friends may call from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. Saturday at the funeral home.

DEATH
Name:
Source: The Marietta Times, Friday, January 17, 2003
Edna R. Kirkbride, nee Truax
WOODSFIELD - Edna R. Kirkbride, 92, of East Marietta Street died Thursday (Jan. 16, 2003) at the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center.
She was born Feb. 21, 1910, in Monroe County, Ohio, to John and Lorena Henthorn Truax. She was a member of Mount Zion Church of Christ.
She was preceded in death by her husband, Isaac H. Kirkbride, in 1978; her parents; three sisters, Mildred Gates, Wilma Kindleberger and Fern Morris; and two brothers, Emmett Truax and Wayne Truax.
She is survived by two sons, Marvin Kirkbride and his wife, Lois, of Woodsfield, and Ronald Kirkbride and his wife, Shirley, of Jerusalem, Ohio; one daughter, Patricia Palmer and her husband, Sonny, of Woodsfield; one brother, Carl Truax of Massillon; two sisters, Ermma Jean Baker of Jerusalem, Ohio, and Betty Phillips of Apple Creek, Ohio; six grandchildren; and six great-grandchildren.

2003
RUCKER,Belva M., nee Clark
Source:Canton(OH) Repository - 18 Jan 2003
Belva M. Rucker, age 70, of Canton, died Friday morning (17 Jan 2003) in Aultman Hospital following an extended illness. Born November 9, 1932, in Bellaire, OH, to the late George F. and Mabel M. (Piatt) Clark. She was a 50 year resident of the Canton area, retiring from the Hoover Company in 1992 after 17 years of service. Member of the Central Congregation of Jehovah's Witness. Preceded in death by her husband, Richard J. Rucker in 1972; brother, William Clark; and sister, Doris Griffith. Survived by two sons and daughter-in-law, George R. and Marguerite Rucker of North Canton, William H. Rucker of Alliance; two daughters and sons-in-law, Mary M. and William Gillis of Canton, Janet S. and Bobby Butler of East Canton; nine grandchildren; two brothers and sisters-in-law, Ray and Drew Howell of Florida, William and Martha Howell of Florida; four sisters and brothers-in-law, Thelma and Emerson Haas of Wooster, Polly Cline of Woodsfield, OH, Helen and Paul Kenney of Athens, OH, Sue and Tom Smith of Bucyrus, OH; numerous nieces and nephews. Funeral service Monday, January 20, 2003, at 10 a.m. in the Kreighbaum-Sanders Funeral Home on South Cleveland Ave. Burial in Sunset Hills Memory Gardens. Friends may call Sunday 2-4 and 7-9 p.m.

Hilma Irene Christy, nee Davis
WOODSFIELD - Hilma Irene Christy, 86, of East Marietta Street died Saturday (Jan. 25, 2003) at Southeastern Ohio Regional Medical Center in Cambridge.
 
She was born March 30, 1916, in Parkersburg to Ralph and Alice Guinn Davis. She was a member of the Woodsfield Church of Christ.
She was preceded in death by her husband, Raymond Christy, in February 1987; her parents; and one brother, Gordon Davis, in November 1986.

Wedding: The Marietta Times, Thursday, january 31, 2003
Hines-Haines
Julie Hines and Daniel Haines II were united in marriage on Dec. 8, 2002, during an outdoor ceremony in St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands. Minister Walter Conradson officiated for the ceremony.
The bride is the daughter of Robert and Joyce Hines of Lewisville. She is the granddaughter of Pauline Hercher of Sycamore Valley and Marjorie Hines of Lewisville.
The bridegroom is the son of Donna Van Meter of Hilliard and Daniel Haines of Mount Vernon. He is the grandson of Ruth Ann Haines of Washington Court House.
The bride is a 1993 graduate of Skyvue High School and a 1997 graduate of Kent State University with a bachelor's degree in psychology and a minor in paralegal studies.
The bridegroom is a 1989 graduate of Worthington High School and a 1996 graduate of Ohio State University with a degree in management information systems.
Both are currently employed at MCI WorldCom; the bride as a contract analyst, and the bridegroom as a software developer.
The couple spent their honeymoon on a Caribbean cruise. They are residing in Hilliard.
